39249754.review:
Shanghai solitaire on a timer, with the common freemium model of limited, slowly replenishing energy that you can buy refreshes of. You can obtain (or pay money for) helpful items like hint bugs that fly around matches for you, hourglasses that give you more time, and magnetic dust that reshuffles the tiles, but no undoes.

Almost identifcal to their [url=store.steampowered.com/app/392950]Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure[/url], except its hidden object levels have been replaced by Shanghai solitaire levels. Same story, same graphics, same music, same quests. If you've played one, you've essentially played them both.

So how's its solitaire? It assumes you know how to play Shanghai solitaire; no instructions are available. Its Shanghai solitaire levels choose a random formation from a wide variety of layouts. Uses traditional mah jongg tile designs with Chinese numbers and season names, with no alternate tile sets. Wrong moves can render your level unwinnable, which you may not discover for minutes, playing until the game acknowledges you have no moves left and gives you the option to buy a reshuffle or start over (if you have enough energy). Its reshuffles are unsatisfactory: I've used a reshuffle, played the only four moves I saw, then had the game again declare no moves left and offer to sell me another reshuffle.

While other players may not mind the countdown timer, personally, I hate playing Shanghai for speed with no undoes when I make a hasty mistake. If you too would like variant tile sets and undoes, you may prefer the non-free [url=store.steampowered.com/app/709610/]Mahjong Match[/url].

Me, I'd play Lost Lands's hidden-object version over this one. Things I like about this game, like some of its music (at least, the tracks that aren't trying to manufacture tension), its decent graphics, and its treasure chest puzzles, were all taken from that one, anyway. But if you want a quick fix of Shanghai solitaire without cheaty undoes, that cuts you off after a few rounds till your energy bar refills, this game'll give that to you for free.

39217272.review:
This game has a very cool story and well-done graphics. It mixes the traditional match-board MahJong levels with some very nice ColorFlow/CrossPath line puzzles to unlock new things.
Although I really love the story and the general gameplay of this game, the "limited energy" scheme is very irritating to deal with. It's pretty much one of those Windows Store / Facebook / Mobile games that make you spend money if you want to play more than a certain limited number of matches per time. If you play it very casually, you won't suffer much with this taken that MahJong matches take some time to finish in general (though limited here by a timer, which combined with the energy scheme is really ridiculous). Yet I do recommend playing this game coz of the story and gameplay.

Для меня плюсы этой игры перевешивают минусы. Но все-таки эта игра не настолько хороша, чтобы рекомендовать ее другим.

Плюсы: 
1) Это маджонг, в который можно играть бесплатно.
2) Графика смотрится довольно приятно

Минусы:
1) Основная моя проблема с этой игрой - слои костей реализованы плохо. Иногда клик промахивается мимо цели, хотя курсор явно находится на костяшке - надо целиться ближе к центру. А еще довольно сложно понять, сколько костей лежит под той, что я снимаю - одна или две, или даже ни одной
2) Игра это из тех условно-бесплатных, которые очень хотят получить ваши деньги. Основная проблема - в том, что где-то через полчаса-час игры у вас закончится энергия и придется либо отложить маджонг до следующего дня, либо платить. Внутриигровая валюта закончится быстро, так что платить придется деньгами.
3) При каждом запуске вылезает реклама и интро - нельзя сразу начать играть, надо каждый раз пропускать все это
4) Сюжет и квесты выглядят прикрученными сбоку и очень картонными.

37804209.review:
Originally I was just looking for a game to play for in-between, with little fuss and low setup. Somehow I ended up sinking a lot of time into this game instead. As with many F2P games you end up spending a lot of time on it initially to maximize your energy refills etc, but as you progress and get a larger energy bar, it gets a lot relaxter because you can leave it alone for half a day and still not have your energy maxed out.

The graphics and sound are beautiful and the quests give you something to aim for while you are matching your tiles. The treasure chest minigames are quite a nice break from the tiles as well, so it won't feel too monotonous. Since characters and environments are animated, nothing feels stale.

The quests are arguably one of the best things about this game, but timed quests can be unfair at times, because they may request items from areas that you reached the level for, but cannot access yet (due to not being able to find the needed unlock item until the story quest asks for it - trust me, you'll likely be above the level you needed by the time you actually unlock it). So if you don't plan on spending money on the game, prepare for a long grind for some of these. Especially since timed quests that ask for collections only add priority to the items of the first collection in the quest, but not the second (and at times, third). I've wasted a lot of energy on the right locations only to come up empty handed.

If you're okay with slow progression (especially at higher levels) and don't mind sinking some time into this, and of course if you love tile-matching, then this game is definitely one of your nicer picks.

Pros
[list]
    [*]Beautiful art
    [*]Ambient sound
    [*]Quests give your tile matching purpose
    [*]Free to Play
    [*]Game auto-pauses if you need to switch tabs (e.g. get a skype call etc)
    [*]Chest Mini-Games take away from potential monotony
[/list]

Cons
[list]
    [*]Time Quests need some fixing
    [*]You'll constantly be reminded that you can spend money on this (don't get me wrong, I understand the need for that, but it can be annoying, especially when the special deals pop up every new level you hit)
    [*]Trying to get the Collection items you need can be quite frustrating
[/list]

I have put in a lot of hours on this game because I like trying to get all achievements in a game (so far, anyway) and these are easy to achieve -- assuming you can get anything done. Very tentative recommendation because it's free, with one big caveat: this is the same game as their previous "Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure," just with mahjong instead of HO scenes. The scenario, quests, chest puzzles -- completely identical, so if you've already played that, there will be no surprises here (and you might already be sick of it).

On the bright side, since a mahjong game takes longer than a HO scene, the energy refresh rate is less immediately frustrating; you can actually play the game for 20-30 minutes before your energy runs out. Also they appear to have set the Steam achievements to trigger when you hit the first milestone in a repeating goal, instead of the fifth one, so it's much quicker to get achievements out of.

35806543.review:
Kinda insidious. If the puzzle shuffles in a way that makes it impossible to complete, you have to pay to reshuffle it and keep going. Attempting it anew wastes the "energy" spent. Paying to reshuffle a puzzle does not guarantee it'll be possible to complete, so the sunk cost fallacy will quickly rob you.

On top of that, you have to grind puzzles for RNG reliant items to progress, artificially lengthening gameplay... Or, again, you can pay real money to bypass an artificial problem.

I get that this is meant to be freemium, but that's not a very nice first impression.

EDIT: After delving deeper, yup, I can confirm that the puzzles are static. And on top of that, a very common tactic they employ to waste your resources is stacking two of the exact same tile on top of one another.

For example; let's say there are four green dragon tiles. Three of them are exposed, so you match two of them. Then, you'll see the fourth appear from underneath one of the two you just removed. That means you had a 33.3% chance to make the game unwinnable in that particular instance, and no way to combat it without either cheating or forking over some cash.

Dirty tactics indeed.

34669865.review:
ATTENTION : Bien qu'il s'appelle aussi Lost Lands, comme "Lost Lands : A Hidden Object Adventure", ce jeu n'a rien à voir avec les autres jeux du même nom des mêmes développeurs de FiveBN (Dark Overlord, The Four Horsemen, The Golden Curse). Il ne repose pas sur le même principe de jeu d'aventure mêlant point&click et énigmes.


C'est l'histoire d'une ville elfe qui vit en paix depuis des siècles quand un jour le mal s'abat sur elle sous la forme de nuages noirs. Les habitants désertent et parcourent les océans à la recherche d'un nouveau lieu de vie mais ils traversent d'impitoyables tempêtes dont seuls quelques survivants en réchappent et échouent sur une île déserte. Ils ont avec eux un sarcophage qui, selon la légende, renferme l'Elu qui saura sauver son peuple de sa terrible destinée le temps venu. C'est alors qu'il se réveille...

C'est après cette introduction que commence le jeu et on se retrouve avec à l'écran une vue aérienne sur un village dans ce qui ressemble à première vue à un petit jeu de stratégie ou de gestion de ressources.
On a un capital de pièces d'or et de cristaux, des points d'XP, un niveau, une jauge d'énergie. On a également accès à un grand inventaire divisés en plusieurs catégories (potion d'énergie, coffres, amulettes, clés, outils, armes).


C'est le même jeu que "Lost Lands : A Hidden Object Adventure" mais les SOC sont simplement remplacées par du mahjong.

33845065.review:
The moment you first load the game, you're in an unskippable tutorial of the "You must click this part of the screen in order to progress to the next part" variety, in which all menus are disabled, so I hope the default volume and resolution work for you.

There's a lot of visually distracting chaff around the game, and writing that tries to draw you in but just ended up pushing me further away.  Kind of overwhelming for a casual game.  The gameplay itself seemed competent, and I'll come back to this one, but the aesthetics and first impression were a real negative for me.  Everything's so focused on being pretty that it's hard to tell what I can and can't click on, to the point where they literally have a button that zooms you over to the right section of the overmap and circles the part you're supposed to click on.  I guess someone in the playtesting phase had the same problem.

It really feels like they hired world of warcraft's concept artists to fully illustrate the game (and world of warcraft is absolutely stunning visually), but they neglected to get anyone familiar with interface design.  Kind of like when platformers don't make any visual distinction between objects that are in the foreground and the background -- you end up lost a lot.

Salut,
Lost Land Mahjong est si vous n'aviez encore pas compris non pas un nouveau genre de jeu futuriste mais un simple mahjong classique incorporé dans un univers de fantaisie. Il est exactement comme tout les mahjong avec la difficulté réglable, de nombreux niveaux . Voila... c'est le jeu de brique chinois quoi.... Seulement on y a rajouté des missions ennuyeuses pour tuer des "monstres maléfiques" et dévérouiller des parties de la carte...

Bref voici l'évaluation :

Graphismes : 
☐ Des étoiles dans mes yeux !
☐ Très bons 
☑ Bons
☐ Acceptables
☐ Moches
☐ Aggression
C'est mahjong quoi le graphisme est net il n'y a pas de graphisme à proprement parlé parceque le jeu est à 90 % un écran fixe sauf quand vous trouvez une paire de brique donc bon.... C'est agréable coloré c'est déja sa.

Jouabilité : 
☑ easy magle !
☐ Jouable avec une bonne prise en main
☐ Difficilement jouable
☐ Injouable/ Affreux
Je ne vais pas faire de commentaire sa serait comme demander si c'est dure de jouer à solitaire...

Durée de vie :
☐ IMMORTELLE !
☐ Extrêmement longue
☑ Longue
☐ Bonne 
☐ Acceptable
☐ Trop courte
☐ Du vol.
A sa les dévelloppeur vous ont pas volés niveau quantité de level vous êtes servi vous en avez pour un bout de temps !

Bande son (bruitages + musiques) : 
☐ Un véritable concerto!
☐ Très bonne
☐ Bonne
☑ Classique
☐ Mauvaise
☐ Saignement oditif !
Le jeu se limite à une musique de fond zen si se n'est pas la musique de fantaisie du menu assez moyenne qui ressemble étrangement à celle d'un autre jeu en ligne qui n'a rien à voir mais bon ....

Scénario : 
☐ Waw !
☐ Très agréable et prenant
☐ Intéressant !
☑ Acceptable mais sans plus
☐ Mais où est le scénariste ?
Vous vous demandez pourquoi je parle de fantaisie sur Mahjong depuis tout à l'heure, voici les explications : Il y a une histoire sur le pourquoi vous faites du Mahjong parceque le mal à envahi les terres elfiques je crois et donc l'intégralité du jeu tourne autour de mission où vous faites un niveau, vous dropez l'objet recherché, vous avancez vous recommencez exetera... L'histoire n'est pas interressante du tout ! les missions sont d'une austérité pas possible.... pour seul but de déverrouillé par exemple la mine ... waw je suis tellement époustouflé  par le réalisme de ce jeu ....

Rapport qualité/prix :
☑ Gratuit 
☐ A ce prix là c'est donné !
☐ Bon prix
☐ Satisfaisant
☐ Discutable…
☐ Racket organisé !
Heuresement qu'il est gratuit parceque sa serait un peu de l'abu de le faire payer.. D'autant plus que si vous êtes comme moi c'est à dire quelqu'un qui commence à jouer et ne s'arrete que quand il en a mare vous allez être déçu de découvrir la politique de nombre de partie possible par jour, qui se recharge avec les temps....ya toujours moyen de payer sa ils ont mis plein d'offres même de quoi acheter les objets pour avancer... à croire qu'il y a des gens qui investissent réellement de l'argent pour avancer dans ce genre de jeu ...

Bref un mahjong plutôt simpliste quoi sauf qu'il est légèrement gaché par tout le tralala d'à côté et ce système de nombre de partie est simplement infecte et insuportable !

33300297.review:
This can become a pretty fun game if you are a patient sort of person.

This is a free game, so there is a pay system set up to help you play longer sessions and to aid you should you get stuck, but you never actually have to pay to fully enjoy the whole game. As long as you don't mind putting in only a half hour once or twice a day and then moving on to something else, this game is fairly satisfying.

The artwork is beautiful and the story is engaging, the mahjong boards vary enough, and there is a fair amount of choice as far as what to do on the map which makes for a surprising strategy element to the game. The chests have some fun little mini-games required to open them so that mahjong games are not the only puzzles you get to play.

It does take a few days or so to get the hang of how the game plays out, but as it is free to try, there is no reason not to give it a whirl and see if this title is for you. If you do find you like this game check out their Lost Lands: Hidden Objects and Mystic Saga (hidden object) games as well.

If you ever thought to youself, "I wish mahjong and RPGs could have a baby," this is the game for you.

PROS: It's free, it's cute, it's not as boring as traditional mahjong.

CONS: You only have so much "energy" to expend, so if you like to play game after game after game, you'll get really frustrated waiting to recharge. Of course, you can "buy" energy (it's a free game, after all, they have to make money somehow).  So you can only play so much before you end up having to wait. Also, the graphics aren't good, and it can be hard to "see" the various matching mahjong tiles (they look very similar as well).

32513915.review:
For a free-to-play game, the music and graphics are pretty nice and well done. The music resembles the kind of music you can find in medieval-strategy-and/or fantasy etc kind of games. It is relaxing. The graphics are good, the map looks interesting and motivating to play. I dont personally like the design of the characters so much, but the story is the kind inspired by Lord of the rings themes (elves, orc-like creatures, humans and so on). I like the creatures in the game and cant wait to discover more. You can unlock new places on the map by playing mahjong and doing quests. Its true that when i played for the first two times, i thought "omg this is too hard, who can finish in the given time AND get three stars??" But then it became easier to see the tiles and i shortly was able to get three stars. It's not an impossible game at all, even your parents can play it :)
Every day you get a gift, but in the sixth or seventh day you start all over again with the first gift. 
A nice surprise was that some quests, not many tho, required the solving of a different kind of puzzle (uniting the dots, for example). 
I am at level 5 now and im not bored yet. Sure, they couldve give more side quests or chances to play different puzzles (like the one i mentioned before) to unlock things.
Another thing i like is that, even if you can buy things with real money, i could play easily without investing money in the game up to this point, without feeling disadvantaged. Currently i am at one quest that is kinda long to complete and i wished it was shorter for this level, but its manageable.
One thing that annoys me a little is the fact that the intro plays everytime unless you click to skip it, it couldve started directly with the map. Also, it annoyed me that i couldnt skip the tutorial AND it made me spend the money or power ups i got at the start of the game. 
I didnt really mind the time you need to wait to regain energy because your eyes get tired from seeking those detailed tiles. At least mine do. :p 
At first you can continue the game when you get no more moves, because you have some power ups, but then if you remain without moves, you need to buy a shufler, and its pretty expensive in game money/diamonds. Thats a downside :(
You earn achievements easily and really quick.
In the end... i mean,if you really like mahjong, this game is a less boring way to play it because of the story and quests. If you're not into mahjong i dont see a reason for you to play this game, because i think you can totaly find better fantasy-quests kind of games out there.

32414799.review:
This game would be a lot more enjoyable, as many others have pointed out, if it wasn't so throttled by energy requirements. I like that there is an ongoing story that gives you incentive to keep playing board after board of Mahjong. That incentive, however, is completely neutered by the energy system. It's frustrating to want to keep going but to hit a wall and have to wait (unless you pony up real money to replenish your energy.) Players that only play short sessions may have less of an issue with this.

I would be happy to pay for this game but not in the form of being nickeled and dimed to death via micro transactions. 

I like the graphics and gameplay otherwise. The graphics, particularly the backgrounds, are gorgeous. The music is relaxing and one of the tracks in particular I enjoy a lot. 

I would only recommend this game if you  a) don't mind forking out real money for micro transactions b) don't mind a disjointed experience that forces you to stop and come back hours later to continue playing c) are a player that only plays for short periods of time each time.

31375505.review:
Lost Lands: Mahjong is a very soothing and relaxing game, perfect after a long day or if you have some time on your hand to spare. :P
Since it is F2P, there is a shop in which you can invest real money for the all-so-famous classic F2P currency, diamonds.

The game also uses quests and items (+ item drops) per area & level and thus keeps everything new and interesting.
Besides items that help the player playing the actual Mahjong, there is also stamina. It has to be used to play in the different areas. Once the stamina is used up, the player either waits, is lucky enough to level up somehow or has to buy items to refill the missing stamina. 

The only cons I can find with this game are the relatively low item drops, but somehow there needs to be a challenge besides Mahjong, and the music that doesn't have a lot of variety and frankly gets slightly annoying at some parts. 

Overall it is a nice way to calm down from the day and I can see myself playing it from time to time. :>
*thumbs up*

I like mahjong and this is a particularly well programmed game with nice graphics and side entertainments.



But: the play-to-a-timer sucks and the only legitimate way past it is to micro-transaction your way to heaven (and land in hell).

I originally accepted the micro-transaction-timer-of-death because it only took you 10 minutes to charge and it takes ~5-10 minutes per game of mahjong. I soon changed my mind when the points required per game of mahjong started to ramp up, increasing the time required to wait quite significantly.

Steam is a platform to buy(subscribe) to games, not a place for games to facebook-style cheat you out of pocket with micro-transactions. This game does not belong.

31079991.review: Gra jest ciekawie zorganizowana. Poza samym układaniem Mahjongowych klocków, jest jeszcze kilka fajnych zagadek logicznych przy otwieraniu skrzynek. Nie wiem czy odbierać to jako pozytywny aspekt czy negatywny, ale owe zagadki po pewnym czasie zaczynają się powtarzać i jeśli nad jakąś głowiłem się wystarczająco długo, za drugim razem już odtwarzam ją z pamięci. We wstępnym etapie energia wydawała mi się bardzo irytująca, bo siadając do mahjonga mam niekiedy ochotę ułożyć więcej niż 3 partie, po czym robić sobie przerwę na kilka godzin, ale zgaduję, że to własnie tutaj leży oczywisty aspekt zarobkowy, bo skoro gra jest f2p, to gdzieś trzeba było zaimplementować coś co pozwoli twórcom jednak zasłużone korzyści z tego projektu odnieść. Muzyka jest przyjemna, odgłosy natury doskonale pasują do oprawy graficznej, zaś system progresu w odkrywaniu świat jest naprawdę świetny. Polecam każdemu kto lubi casualowe gierki, nawet jeśli tak jak ja przed rozpoczęciem przygody z Lost Lands: Mahjong nigdy w te klocki się nie bawił. Jedynym zauważalnym godnym wypunktowania minusem w ocenie tej gry (w mojej subiektywnej opinii rzecz jasna) jest fakt, że gra już od bardzo dawna nie miała żadnego patchu (ani chodźby eventu) co sprawia, że prawdopodobnie rozwijać dalej się już nie będzie. A szkoda, bo potencjał w niej (według mnie) drzemie nie mały.

30947950.review:
Mahjong is a fun, exciting game. 

This version is set on the overlay of other Lost Lands puzzle games, and the developers rely on microtransactions I suppose to make end's meet. 

However, I don't recommend this for several very basic reasons: The game of Mahjong itself relies on shuffling the pieces when you reach an impasse. Every F2P game I've played has included this. However, in this version, you will have to pay to buy more shuffles. 

I don't mind paying to proceed with the game if it's going slowly. I do mind basic Mahjong mechanics being pay-to-use. I'll probably be uninstalling this soon and finding any of the other options out there.

Mh ... im Grunde ein Mahjong-Spiel verpackt in eine 2D-Landschaft. Man muß durch Lösen der Majong-Puzzles Teile für benötigte Reparaturen auftreiben, um weitere Gebiete betreten zu können.

Leider wurde "Free to Play" um die inzwischen übliche "but Pay to progress faster"-Komponente erweitert ... man kann (muß aber nicht) für echte Dollars bzw. Euro's Ingame-Währung kaufen, mit der entweder benötigte Energie-Auffüllungen oder fehlende Ersatzteile gekauft werden können.

30035590.review:
Занятное сочетание головоломок с условно-бесплатной игрой, которых много создано для смартфонов. 
Из плюсов: 1) Хорошее исполнение игры, качественные головоломки.
2) Сюжет, хоть и не представляет что-то совершенно новое, интересен.

Минусы: 1) Для совсем комфортной игры требуются денежные вливания.
2) Головоломки однообразны, и не всегда видно усложнение их.
3) Пасьянс раскладывается в локациях, в каждой локации 10 "уровней", в которых меняется фигура, выкладываемая костями. Такое ощущение, что фигура выкладывается каждый раз одинаковым образом, в результате есть уровни, которые можно пройти только используя перемешивание, которое требует игровую валюту или деньги.

То, что на действия расходуется энергия, можно отнести как к плюсам (нельзя просидеть за игрой слишком долго, выпав из жизни), так и к минусам (иногда этого так хочется).

28926750.review:
So this game has been on my wishlist for a while, but I've put off installing it because of the flood of negative reviews suggesting that progression is impossible without paying.

Seriously, I have no idea what these people have been smoking. I've been binge playing this game for nine hours over two days and have never hit a wall; nor have I ever been tempted to pay money.

The game looks gorgeous, there are constant drops and unlocks and great progression to keep one motivated (every two or three games is another unlock), there are lots of layouts and the game plays smooth and crisp with absolutely no bugs.

Every now and then I run out of time and simply log back in a couple of hours later with my time bar completely refreshed. Well, it's a casual game and I'm happy to have an excuse to take a break. (In any case, your action bar is refilled every time you level up and extra time potions drop fairly frequently.)

Teasing out the negative reviews, I would guess that over half of these players wouldn't even have looked at the game (or reviewed it) in the first place if it wasn't free to play. Many have played for less than an hour. And for those players down voting the game with 40+ hours, I reckon they've had their money's worth. lol.

Most of the negative reviews can broadly be described as either 1) people who think Mahjong solitaire is too hard, 2) people who think that casual games (that is, "facebook" or "mobile" games) don't belong on Steam, and/or 3) people who don't like free to play models based around limited timers.

For #1 and #2, I don't even... Seriously, don't look at Mahjong solitaire games if you don't like or have no interest in learning how to play Mahjong solitaire games.

For #3, I can't imagine that these players have done much more than have a toddler tantrum the first time they ran down the timer and had to find something else to do for a bit. I guess, if you're the kind of person who wants to spend a whole day playing nothing but Mahjong solitaire without a break then sure, this isn't your game. There are several other perfectly fine options you might want to look at instead if you have the cash.

For everyone else you really can't go wrong here. This is one of the best Mahjong solitaire games out there. As a bonus, it's free!

28686491.review:
Когда эльфы бежали от неведомого зла и нашли приют на острове, который стал их тюрьмой, они, по счастью, прихватили с собой древний саркофаг, где находился их герой как бы в криогенном сне. Вы играете за эльфийского богатыря, который очнулся спустя много лет и должен [strike]разобрать весь этот бардак[/strike] исполнить древнее пророчество. В немного похожую историю попал бедный коммандер Явик. Но когда он очнулся через тысячи лет, оказалось, что весь его народ уничтожен Жнецами, а он единственный живой представитель. И все, что ему осталось, - боль и страдания. В этой же истории эльфийский богатырь сразу видит, что он не один. Во главе эльфов стоит новая предводительница. Ура! Теперь эльфийский род может продолжиться. Но гордая Венатор совершенно не желает говорить о продолжении рода и даже признавать героя. Феминистических идей, видно, нахваталась. Принеси ей артефакт, победи кого-то там, докажи, что ты [strike]не верблюд [/strike] высший эльф. На самом деле у героев происходит множество событий: битвы, сражения с чудовищами, посещения замков и заключение союзов, магические ритуалы, даже праздники и пиры. Но для игрока все веселое заменяется партией в маджонг. Хотя это не единственное, чем можно заняться в игре: можно собирать коллекции предметов, гонять всяких монстров, открывать сундуки (читай мини-головоломки).
 
Геймплэй очень похож на другую головоломку Clover Tale от этого же разработчика (и, очевидно, действие происходит в той же вселенной). Clover Tale произвела на меня сильное впечатление. И поэтому когда  я увидела здесь эти цветастые локации, которые нужно качать, этих тварюшек, разгуливающих по дорогам, услышала эти разговоры о великом зле, - в этот раз я уже сказала не «Ах!», а «Да, хорошо, но примерно то же я уже видела, а некоторые вещи можно было даже сделать получше». Я имею в виду, что в этой игре кое-что нельзя сделать даже за донат. Например, попасть в локацию, если нет нужных предметов. И общее впечатление, пожалуй, как в том анекдоте про рыбака, который за весь день ничего не поймал и сказал: «Если бы рыбалка так не успокаивала – УБИЛ БЫ ВСЕХ!!!». С одной стороны, красочная и увлекательная головоломка. С другой стороны, некоторые мини-игры с сундуками, например, сундук единорога, предположительно созданы этим самым великим злом. Вообще невозможно пройти. На 20 уровне пошли «интересные» задания, например, исследовать Башню магов 3 раза. Задание выполнено? Молодец, теперь опять исследуй Башню магов 3 раза. Вообще после 15 уровня уже требуется как-то себя понуждать, чтобы проходить игру: все становится очень предсказуемым. Здания починены, появляется куча лишних досок и камней, которые никому не нужны, но при этом добывать проклятые веревочные лестницы и жезлы – сложная задача, так как они нигде не производятся. И можно несколько раз прочесать все локации и не найти ни одного искомого предмета!  Но если настроиться нужным образом, это не будет раздражать. Маджонг – игра, где требуется терпение. Не удалось открыть сундук, и энергия закончилась? Ничего, я зайду вечером, когда она восстановится, или завтра. Торопиться в самом деле нечего. Никаких водяных чипов добывать в срок не надо. Эльфы и так хорошо устроились на этом острове. И какая разница: просто раскладывать маджонг или раскладывать его, мотивируя себя тем, что после этого найдешь для эльфийки щетку, чтобы она могла причесать единорога, и квест закончится?

Маджонговая составляющая, может быть, не очень блещет. Всегда 144 фишки с одинаковыми текстурами. Но меняется задний фон, и слышны умиротворяющие мелодии и звуки природы. И, конечно, нельзя не отметить замечательные картинки с персонажами. Как красиво их волосы развеваются на ветру, какие они колоритные, особенно ундина с жабрами у подмышек…

Несмотря на некоторые недостатки, мне кажется, что это прекрасная игра. Может быть, один из лучших маджонгов в Steam на момент написания обзора. А еще она бесплатная. Имеется донат, но он не критичен, особенно при подходе к игре, описанном выше. Хотя в какие-то моменты игра вызывала негодование больше, чем  какой-нибудь позорный проигрыш в Overwatch, но я очень довольна, что поиграла в нее.
 
PS: А в финале игры оказывается, что герою все-таки удалось размножиться и продолжить эльфийский род. Только кто стал его избранницей? Вдруг это была отнюдь не Венатор, а ундина?

Too much pay to play involved, good if you only want to play for 20 minutes a day like candy crush.
You play by using energy, and you only get a certain number of maximum energy points, which increases by 10 as you level up, and refills one point every roughly 3 minutes. Too bad the levels themselves increase in cost, so instead of actually getting more rounds as you level up your max energy, you end up getting less. I have 200 max points, and levels now cost an average of 50 points to play. that's about 10 minutes per day of gametime, since now I have to wait 50 x 3 minutes just to get enough energy to play one level. So pretty soon it will be a 2 day wait to play. And of course many of the puzzles are unsolvable, and you still lose your energy. There is no way in hell i would ever give money to this game, it might encourage the designers to make more of these money grabbing wastes of time. Games like this should stay on facebook where they belong. and who the hell would downvote the truth other than the greedy designers? You may fool some stupid kids into stealing money from their parents to play, but nobody with any sense is going to pay to enjoy this game. You'd all be better off to google mahjong, there's hundreds of better ones that don't try to charge you for a free game that is widely found.

27758239.review:
As others say: [list]
[*]This is a Microstransactions, Facebook/Phone App style game
[*]It's a carbon copy of Lost Lands: Hidden Objects
[*]It has an energy system (Starts with 70 energy, 1 puzzle is approx 15 energy)
[*]It constantly reminds you it's a pay2win game with locked puzzles that encourage you to buy things instead of earning items.
[*]The music IS strangely high quality for a cheap Facebook-style casual game.
[/list]

What I haven't really seen yet in reviews is: [list]
[*]Tabbing out/Being idle leads to advertisement windows to buy other games from the company.
[*]There are advertisements on the main map screen to check out their other games.
[*]There is absolutely zero customization in the game other than sound/resolution options.
[*]It's actually pretty laggy, my high-end gaming comp shouldn't have laggy flash-quality in-game animations.
[/list]

As far as playing the minigames goes: [list]
[*]lolwow 
[*]Forget casual chill Mahjong, it's on a timer. There is no timer-less mode.
[*]The hint option is an on-use item, meaning you have to pay to buy more hints after you use your free 10--the supply is game-wide. Used 7 in the first puzzle? Enjoy 3 in the second puzzle.
[*]Lost? 3 free rewinds, pay afterwards, or start from the beginning.
[*]No undo function that's free in the event you get horribly stuck.
[*]THE LEARNING CURVE? There is none. First two puzzles are easy. Second one took me 4 run-throughs to figure out how they wanted me to do it.
[*]"Treasure chests" are locked behind an additional puzzle type which also has zero learning curve.
[/list]
Personal gripe: 
Our glorious elves, the focus race of this game, live in Western European Stucco Roof Homes, bury their dead in Egyptian Coffins, sail on Norwegin Viking Style Longboats, and dress like Northern European farmers having a midlife crisis and running off into the forests to be Pan-worshiping leaf-wearers. The menu is Greco-Roman-Chinese (???) with awkward gilded edges and "elf-like" additions. It's an architectual fiasco and looks like a high school art student threw up on the entire game. Then they strangely left mildly altered traditional Mahjong tiles intact.

26742210.review:
This game is a wait or pay game. If you want to play truly free, you can only do very limited actions per day. If you want to speed up, you'll have to pay to practically everything. They give free stuff everyday but it's barely enough. As the time on my record shown (108 hours), it's the time (mostly idle) excluding night time to get to lvl 13, without paying anything.

Is it a nice game? Yes, to some extent, it gets repetitive after a while. There are puzzles other than mahjong match. You can fix up locations to make it produce stuff, including potion, amulet, chest, key, weapon, resources, etc. after a period of time. The puzzles varies from easy to hard, with a timer for added challenge. Tip: [spoiler]Other than mahjong, you can print screen the puzzle, pause it, paste it to paint or something similar and figure out the puzzle without running out of time. For mahjong, the set up for each level doesn't change, so make sure you remember or note down the crucial tiles of some levels, like same tiles on top of each other, otherwise you'll get stuck running out of moves.[/spoiler]

Is it a gold digger game? Yes, because every action costs stamina or resources. So, unless you only play daily for fun until stamina rans out and leave it be to do other stuff like me, you'll have to pay to speed up the process. Well, if you don't have patience and not willing to pay, skip it. But honestly, I'm used to these types of games, many free Iphone games and MMORPG are pretty similar to this, which is you pay to advance quickly or wait. For me it's fine, but it doesn't appeal to players who just want to sit several hours playing a game.

自分好みのゲームで楽しんだ方がいいでしょうね..

26316651.review:
Für Mahjong Liebhaber ist das ein netter Zeitvertreib. Da leider Energie verwendet werden muss, um ein Spiel zu starten, kann es durchaus vorkommen, dass man entweder eine Zeit lang nicht spielen kann oder man etwas kaufen soll. Ist aber definitiv nett gestaltet und die Story ist auch ganz nett. 

Gespielt wird in mehreren Bereichen, wo man immer bis zu 3 Sternen bekommen kann, je nachdem, wie schnell man war. Durch bestimmte Items kann man allerdings auch die Zeit anhalten oder die Steine neu anordnen lassen, wenn man keine Züge mehr machen kann. Dies kann ganz nützlich sein, wenn man auf die letzte Sekunde zB mal den letzten Stern bekommen möchte. Wichtig zu erwähnen ist auch, dass, wenn man die Level spielt und eine gewisse Anzahl an Sternen hat, man nicht mehr 1, sondern 2 oder 3 Items bekommt, was auch wichtig für die Story ist, da dort viele Items verlangt werden.

Man hat viele Missionen, sowohl Neben- als auch Hauptstory technisch. Man muss sie nicht unbedingt machen, allerdings bekommt man immer eine kleine Belohnung und immer neue Aufgaben. 

Neben den typischen Mahjong Elementen, gibt es auch noch ein paar andere Rätsel, die gemacht werden können, wenn man beispielsweise Kisten öffnet. So hat man dort auch nochmal etwas anderes, so dass es nicht schnell langweilig wird. Diese Rätsel können sowohl einfach, als auch etwas schwieriger sein.

Wenn man keine Probleme damit hat, auch mal etwas zu warten oder aufhören zu müssen, kann ich das Spiel auf jeden Fall empfehlen, vor allem, da man eigentlich kein Geld ausgeben muss, um das Spiel zu spielen und weiterzukommen. =)

25920042.review:
Вы легендарный эльф, проспавший тысячи лет, но вас пробудили и теперь вы должны помочь своему народу и спасти остров (попутно собирая хлеб и собирая чучело)… собирая маджонг!

Перед нами классическая игра из вконтаке (точнее она есть в facebook) со всем вытекающим: ограниченная энергии на шаги, ежедневные бонусы, всякого собирательного хлама, разве что нет собери 20 друзей получи плюху. Кстати о хламе: будет момент, когда придется просто гриндить, а был момент, когда мне пришлось прокачиваться без квестов (да тут есть опыт и прокачка, как и локаций, так «героя»). 

Все что вам нужно: собирать Маджонг. Много собирать. МНОГО. С десяток локаций, в каждой по 10 разных комбинаций и каждую комбинацию вам придется собирать не раз, так как придется добывать ресурсы и прокачиваться. Ресурсы тратятся везде: на убийство врагов, строительство домов (дают бонусы), на собирательство коллекций (дают награду и требуются на квесты). 

К сожалению сюжет не закончен и просит подождать обновы. Как бесплатная игра – хорошая казуалка в которую можно заходить раз-два в день и сокращать фишечки. Для тех кто не любит маджонг, есть аналог с поиском предметов. Наслаждайтесь

25824845.review:
Nice Mahjong game with quests, minigames, items, ... (and sadly limits on how much you can play).

Cons:
- Ads for other games of the publisher on every start
- Intro plays every time (but can be skipped)
- The first-start tutorial must be played through before options menu (volume!) can be accessed
- Some resolutions (like windowed 800x600) *seem* to be supported and can be configured, but do not work. The smallest windowed resolution i was able to get is 1366x768.
- Many actions in the game cost your character energy. This essentially prevents you from playing the game at your own pace and is probably supposed to annoy the player into micropaying more energy. For a casual player, this shouldn't be an issue though; you can play "enough" games in a day and come back hours or days later without a problem. Hardcore players (or myself on a bad-weather weekend) will hit the limit in 30 minutes to an hour or two and be annoyed by it.

Neutrals:
0: The game feels a bit clumsy sometimes and you have to get used to the UI. Not all clickable things look to be clickable at first, and some clickable things don't do exactly what you expect (f.e. it isn't always clear what your next step in a quest should be, "to target" brings you to the monster you're supposed to finally fight, but you're still missing an item for that, so you have to figure out where you can get the item by yourself. The game could make that more obvious.)
0: Even when you know what a button does/is (like location buttons in the "where do i get this item?" view), you can't really tell them apart because they look so similar. This could be fixed f.e. with additional permanent text or mouseover text.

Pros:
+ Mahjong is fun, and there's a small tutorial for it. (There's a 10 minute time limit for every game, which you can only extend if you have certain items, which you don't always have.)
+ There's an elaborate tutorial for the whole game, which is well done overall. (It can't be skipped though.)
+ The chest-opening minigames are fun, too. (The time limit on them can be a bit hard, though.)
+ The stories around the quests are nice and child-frienldy (and maybe a bit childish at times).
+ The Steam version is waaay less buggy than the Android app.

25310765.review:
Lost Lands: Mahjong is a F2P Mahjong puzzle game with a story that draws you in and objectives that make you keep playing.

Story: You awoken from a long sleep. All ships from different races have sailed and sunk into this mysterious island that no one can escape. There is a lot of bitterness going on with all types of races on the island. To make things worse, there are even monsters harassing inhabitants on the island. There are quests such as defeating monsters, help defend a village, gather collections, and even developing relationships. There is even a part 2 after completing all the quests! Please note that the story is the same as Lost Lands: Hidden Object.

Gameplay: Like any mahjong game, it's matching pieces and clearing the board. You get a certain amount of energy that regenerates over time. To assist that, you can fix up buildings and bridges to help. Later on, however, the energy consumption is more and you may have to rely on gem purchases to speed or progress through the game. Luckily, you get free gems for logging in daily and leveling up.

The only problem I had that stopped me for a good while was getting the Ritual Scythe from the Falger. I know they recently updated to include Sacrificial Island, which drops the scythe, but I'm not sure if the chance of getting it is still difficult or not. Otherwise, I managed to get it and progress through the story.

Graphics: The graphics are detailed like an artbook and the scenery is amazing on the playing board.

Music: The music sounds great and relaxing. However, there is only two tracks. One on the menu and one on the playing board. This can get a tad bit annoying listening to it.

Overall: Lost Lands: Mahjong is like those complimentary free-to-play games that want you to have fun and has a lot of room for not needing to purchase things with real money. Most F2P games out there have ridiculous puzzles to make you buy something to complete it. However, this is the opposite. Other than the energy system, even if the game was F2P, it would make you buy the game itself for the job-well-done on the graphics, puzzles, collections, and quests.

Pros:
-Beautiful Artwork
-Smooth Gameplay
-Great storyline and quests

???:
Getting the Ritual Scythe. With the recent update you can get it from Sacrificial Island rather than just Falgers. However, not sure if the chance is better.

Cons:
-Repetitive music.
-Energy system which can limit the amount of gameplay time per day.

25114020.review:
С точки зрения маджонга все хорошо, приятная графика, набор разных раскладок...
С точки зрения микротранзакций, довольно прижимистая FtP. Здесь имеется система энергии. Энергии хватает примерно на 15минут игры, восстанавливается она либо за 4-6 часов, либо за счет финансовых вложений. В квестах на починку, которые энергию должны повышать, постоянно не хватает каких-то элементов, при чем в большинстве случаев у вас нет 90% необходимого, а докупить остальное предлагается за доп. плату. Обратный отсчет времени тоже вносит свою лепту, вроде бы как игра должна быть  расслабляющей, а не кликалкой на время. Но иначе не продашь в магазине часики с временным бонусом, верно? Отмены хода тоже нет из тех же соображений. Вам лучше продадут перетасовку. А если вы по каким-то причинам с первых 10 раз не поняли, вас периодически довольно навязчиво отправляют в магазин или радуют всплывающими окнами с "ограниченными предложениями" со скидкой. 
Да, есть среди FtP игры, где микротранзакции ненавязчивы и уместны. Предлагая вам дополнительные козыри, они, тем не менее, позволяют вам нормально неспешно играть. Но это не тот случай. Как сказал один комментатор "это игра такого типа, которая постоянно заставляет вас ощущать себя растерянным и бессильным, пока вы не вбросите в нее очередную порцию денег, однако, на многое ее не хватает и очень скоро вы возвращаетесь к этому чувству..." Добиться подобного эффекта с помощью обычного маджонга кажется довольно непростой задачей, но у разработчиков это отлично получилось. 
В общем, если бы ни система с назойливой рекламой при запуске и предложениями купить то одно, то другое и не такие жесткие ограничения, было бы хорошо. 

Еще по-мелочи: с выдачей наград за квест бывают сбои и иногда вы ее получаете не полностью или совсем не получаете, или отсчет времени сбрасывается и накидывает еще несколько часов, если награда была по времени. Конечно, вам выдают не так много, так что это не особо важно, но вот терять сундучки бывает обидно - головоломки по их открытию довольно занимательные.

24920835.review: if you like mahjong but don't want to pay for a mahjong game (like me, you want as much free stuff as possible), then this game is for you. yeah, there's a bunch of other side stuff going on that seems a little confusing to me right now what with only being 2 hours into it-but all that stuff is ignorable. it's largely the typical free to play model of keep playing for hours to unlock new stuff. but since this game is just mahjong, it all revolves around mahjong stuff. those items you can buy in the store are mostly things to reshuffle the tiles if you can't progress or to stop the clock (you have 10 minutes to complete each game of mahjong) to give you more time if you need it to beat a hard game. or you can buy keys to unlock the chests and skip the potentially incredibly annoying minigames you are forced to play to unlock chests for some reason. you can also buy weapons to kill/remove the various roving bands of enemies on the world map. did i mention the game has a sort of story outside playing mahjong? it's kind of interesting so far. it appears you're one of the firstborn elves and you are awakened on this island that all your elven brethren are trapped on and you go around to the various spots on the island and play mahjong there with varying degrees of difficulty depending on how far you've progressed. (again, i'm only 2 hours in so far so i imagine i only have access to the beginner difficulty mahjong layouts.) you can unlock more new areas of the island and collect different resources to repair various broken down parts on the island that also give you slight bonuses that i imagine you'll need later on in the game. i came into this game just expecting a simple, working digital version of mahjong and i totally got it and so much more. none of the side stuff feels forced on me-i can just play hundreds of hours of free mahjong if i want. the only downside so far seems to be the energy bar that you deplete as you visit locations and play mahjong there. certain areas require more energy than others and you only recover a certain amount every couple of minutes. (that's where repairing the broken down stuff and unlocking new parts of the island come in. you get time cut off of your recharge rate, allowing you to play longer before it's empty and you have to go back to playing another game while it recharges.) but if no mechanic like that existed in this game, the makers would have almost no way to make money, so i get it. i'm not happy about it, but i get it.

Free to play, pay to win, but a very enjoyable game if you don't mind that format. The game does not spam you with requests or popups asking you to buy their items, and it seems perfectly possible to progress without them with a little patience (or if you're just casual and only play for short periods at a time). The fantasy setting is very nice to look at, with pretty animated backgrounds that are interesting without being distracting, accompanied by nature sounds. The writing is incredibly generic, but I don't think anyone expects much of a story from these kinds of games.

As it's free, I think it is a nice game to try for people who just want to do some casual clicking <3 The only con for me is the fact that there are not alternate designs for the tiles, as I find the default one a little difficult (but it is the standard mahjong tiles). Ultimately a fun, if slightly forgettable game.

24528563.review:
I grew up playing Mahjong and I've always really loved it. This game is pretty fun so far.

UPDATE: The short review I made was for a "mission" at the beginning of the game. Now that I've gotten all the achievements on the game I feel like it is time for a new review. 

I quickly became addicted to this game and it became a part of my daily routine. Every morning I would get on this game to use the energy I had accumulated over night. I would also get on multiple times throughout the day, even if I only had enough energy to do one puzzle. 

There were two things that I really hated about this game but, considering it is a free game, they are to be expected. The first is the way the energy works. Basically like a Facebook or mobile game where you have to wait for it to recharge. At first it was awful having to wait. Overtime, once I got used to it I really didn't mind too much and quickly found ways to make it less awful.
The second thing I hated was that if you were doing a puzzle and ran out of moves, that was it. You just wasted energy on that puzzle for no reason. The only way to shuffle the pieces is if you have the right tool for it. Or by buying the tool with gems which you can pay for with real money or aquire a few upon leveling up. Eventually, I found the puzzles for each area that I could beat without messing up and just played those each time.

Overall, it's a decent game especially being free. I would recommend it for someone who wants something to kill a little bit of time each day. And someone who likes puzzles. There are other puzzles besides Mahjong.

Free2play Pay2win most annoying Mahjong solitaire game ever. (There's also a puzzle mode where you need to connect same-color dots on a gid without having lines cross.)

This game has energy bars - if you're out of energy, you can't play.
Levels are timed - but you can buy time extension items - and you get stars (and other rewards?) proportional to how fast you are - but you can play very fast if you just memorize a level and play it again - which means playing the same level over and over.
Of course there's also a plethora of items, collections, and stuff that's locked that needs items to unlock, and more: lots of things to keep you busy, tied to the game, and doing anything but playing Mahjong.
And there's a night mode where you play with a flashlight - with upgrade items to make you see more, of course.

There are enough Mahjong games out there that aren't actively trying to spoil your fun in the hopes that you pay them. Some are even free.

23996327.review:
Ich habe das Spiel ziemlich lange gespielt und doch, ich persönlich kann es nicht empfehlen, auch wenn es kostenlos ist.

Ich mag zum Zeitvertreib Spiele wie Mahjong. Das Spiel liefert dies scheinbar en masse, verpackt in eine "Handlung" bei der die Orte erst freigespielt werden müssen. Als Beiwerk gibt es viele Minispiele, Gegenstände, Sets, Queste, Errungenschaften, Levels, etc.

Die Minispiele reichen von trivial bis (selten) in der vorgegebenen Zeit kaum zu schaffen.
Die Mahjong-Spiele sind einfach. Sie sind auch mit Zeitlimit (3 Stufen), allenfalls die 3. Stufe kann etwas schwer sein.

Es erscheint also eine ziemlich luxuriöse Ausge eines Mahjong-Spieles zu sein.

Am Anfang kommt man auch gut voran, ein Ort nach dem anderen wird freigeschaltet und bei jedem sind die Steine in einer Vielzahl an Varianten angeordnet. Sehr schön. Ich hätte es glatt empfehlen können.

Aber spätestens bei Level 20, bei geschätzt 10 freigeschalteten Orten mit je ca. 10 Mahjong-Spielen merkt man, dass das Spiel zäh wird. Mam erhält massig Gegenstände, aber kaum die, die man braucht, um weiter voranzukommen.

Das zwingt dazu, die bereits so oft aufgesuchten, bekannten Orte wieder und wieder aufzusuchen, um dadurch irgendwann die passenden Gegenstände zu erhalten. Auch die Levelfortschritte, die zum Freischalten weiterer Orte ebenfalls notwendig sind, gehen nun nur noch äußerst zäh vonstatten.

Ich habe (grob geschätzt) für die ersten 14 Level 20 Stunden gebraucht, für die nächsten 5 Level 20 Stunden und für Level 20 nochmal 20 Stunden !!!

(Interessant die Frage, wieviel Zeit man bräuchte, um das Spiel ohne Kauf zu Ende zu spielen...)

Dies könnte man korrekt als frustrierend bezeichnen, wäre da nicht die Möglichkeit, sich Edelsteine und Gold zu kaufen, mit der man die fehlenden Dinge erwerben kann. Nur kaufen bedeutet wirklich kaufen (Mikrotransaktionen).

Das schlimme daran ist, dass, glaube ich, es genauso gewollt ist. Selbst wenn ich irgendwann Level 21 oder gar 22 erreichen wprde, es würde immer aufwendiger.

Für mich ist klar:

* Ich erkaufe mir doch nicht einen Levelfortschritt
* Wenn, dann wird das wahrscheinlich richtig teuer, wenn man das Spiel durchspielen will
* Oder man investiert ewig viel Zeit, um voranzukommen

Man kann es auch anders sehen, aber für mich grenzt dies an Bauernfängerei.

Ich hätte durchaus gerne das Spiel durchgespielt, aber so nicht.

Pro & Contra:
+ Viele Spiele
+ Vieles Drumherum

- Die Fortschritte werden immer zäher, je länger man spielt
- Entsprechend kann man viele Orte kaum bespielen
- Man mag verleitet sein, für Fortschritte zu bezahlen

Wertung: 03/10

Das Spiel unterhält anfangs auf leichte Art, dann frustriert es und will zum Kauf von "Fortschritten" verleiten.

23797987.review:
Tl, dr: Best pure Mahjong, has energy.

If you can play for 30 minutes, two or three times a day, and if you like Mahjong, don't hesitate. The gamepla is the smoothest you'll see anywhere, there is tons of "maps" you progress decently, there is lot of polish.
The game is very fair, obviously you will run into unsolvable situations, but with propper strategy you can minimize those cases, a have yet to see clearly "buy-reshuffles" map, and the amount of times i had 50 pieces left with only one move possible, leading in a chain into victory shows games are properly built, rather than just randomized, which could lead to unsolvable-from-the start map.

The day you will want to play for more than 30 minutes is the day you will uninstall this.
Energy allows you to play maybe 4 games at a time, and then take couple hours to recharge.

Also there is no inovation in the base game. 144 pieces every time, same pictures every time. Maps are very nice, with some clear ways and some deep hiden ways to optimeze and make sure you dont get stuck, but I'm not sure how long it will last.
I'm having fun, but how do you recommend a game that does not want you to play it?
And no, I will not buy energy, when I could just buy a game, and play it when I want, not when IT is in the mood.

23532910.review: ein tolles, anderes Mahjong. Es gibt eine Karte mit verschiedenen Orten, die man alle erforschen kann. Das passiert, indem man Mahjong spielt. Dabei findet man Gegenstände, die man wieder bei Spielen einsetzen kann oder mit denen man Aufgaben lösen kann. Das kann zum Beispiel ein Gegenstand sein, den man braucht, um etwas zu reparieren oder um Zugang zu einem neuen Ort zu erhalten. Jeder Ort kann in mehreren Stufen erforscht werden. Für sehr gute Spiele bekommt man bis zu drei Sterne. Hat man ein Schwert oder einen Speer, kann man die Monster auf der Karte erledigen und dafür Belohnungen bekommen. Bei jedem Mahjong-Spiel verbraucht man Energie, die man mit Tränken aufladen kann oder man muss aufhören zu spielen. Dafür bekommt man aber Belohnungen, wenn man täglich spielt. Und das alles gratis. Dieses Mahjing wird nicht langweilig.

If you are reading the reviews for this game, I will presume that you enjoy games of this type.  As such, I can strongly recomend this game, at this point in my playing of it.      If you want a free Mahjong game, this some puzzles thrown in, and a dash of narative, and a sprinkle of fantasy, you have struck gold with this title.

     -full disclosure-  There is a 'Facebook-ian' energy timer in the game, so you may not be able to 'binge play', There is an option to throw money at the game, to speed up up your progress, if you are in a mad dash to get to the 'end game'.  So, if that is a deal breaker, consider yourself fairly warned.

     P.S.  You may wish to brush up on your chinese numeric character recognition.  Just sayin'

Great game if you just want to casually play some Mahjong with something a little extra. The game is pretty to look at, the quests give a little extra motivation/objective, and there's also additional puzzles to open chests if you're fond of that sort of thing.

I'll admit the micro-transactions and waiting for energy to replenish is annoying, but personally I don't mind it since once my energy bar is depleted I go and do something else.

So as long as you're not in a hurry to meet objectives or want to spend hours in one sitting playing (without paying, of course), it's a great way to pass the time inbetween things and there's enough boards that you're bound to find a one in each location that you don't mind playing over and over :3

Если Вам нечем заняться и вы иногда роетесь в винде с целью поискать сапера, косынку или тот же маджонг - это то, что нужно. И если Ваша задача - не убить ВСЕ рабочее время, а только часть его (работать же тоже иногда нужно), эта игра даст такую возможность, ибо энергийка эльфийского полудохлика быстренько заканчивается, а донатить душит огромная зеленая жаба ("Да и зачем? До конца рабочего дня всего-то минуток 45 осталось, ща книжечку почитаем", - Жаба).
+: просто, приятно, убивалка времени.
=: донат. Минус тут не ставлю, ибо без него задроты проходили бы игру за сутки, а так создается видимость эпической саги :)
Резюме: 8 полудохлых эльфиков из 10. Рекомендую

23401528.review:
Lost lands mahjong ... évaluation en demie teinte pour ma part.

Le jeu étant gratuit je vais tempérer mon argumentation.

Premièrement le jeu est gratuit ! 

Deuxièmement le mahjong est toujours sympa, donc ce jeu est pas mal.

Troisièmement le jeu n'a pour l'instant aucune fin, la toute dernière quête c'est "attendez vous à des quêtes incroyables dans la prochaine mise à jour afin de découvrir la fin du jeu !!!" 
OK ....

Bien que je doute que grand monde soit arrivé à la fin.

Le jeu est pas mal mais disons qu'il souffre de très très gros problème.

Un mahjong classique, en jeu sur pc j'entend, à un générateur aléatoire de placement, aucune partie n'est deux fois la même, mais ici c'est pas le cas. Vous avez peut-être 50 placements différents de plateau, et on retombe souvent sur les même plateaux de jeu. La conséquence est que quand vous tombez coincé à certains moments parce que vous avez loupé deux trois mouvement, vous aurez beau claquer les item pour mélanger les pièces leur placement est totalement absurde. De manière générale, si vous devez claquer un item pour progresser, attendez-vous à en claquer 3-4 dans la foulée car les placement se font à l'arrache.

Est-ce fait exprès pour nous obliger à en utiliser plein, sachant que ceux-ci s'obtiennent très difficilement gratuitement mais que vous pouvez toujours les acheter via un cash shop dans le jeu ?

C'est le coeur du problème du jeu, soit vous êtes très très patient, soit vous êtes un acheteur compulsif, mais dans les deux cas le système est fait, à dessein ou non, pour vous faire claquer des items à tour de bras.

Le jeu reste sympa mais sans plus. Il y a de meilleur mahjong sur le steam store ;)

Je recommande histoire de, mais si vous êtes acheteur compulsif passez votre chemin xD

23340494.review:
I played the hidden object version of this game by the same developers, and just like the previous version, it was all fine until it became a grind. While this version has some improvements over the hidden object one, they didn't fix the ladder issue. As you play the game, you explore different areas to do the mahjong puzzles. Some areas you unlock later on will need "access keys" everytime you need to explore that area. All access keys can be farmed through buildings you repair - except ladders. You also need two ladders for every mahjong game you play in its area. You have no way to reliably aquire these ladders, which makes for a lot of unnecessary grinding to progress in the game. Really, after a few hours of gameplay (probably spread over a few weeks if you're not microtransacting your way through), it's all just grinding.

If you like mahjong, and you liked Lost Lands: Hidden Object, you'll probably like this game too. But I really don't recommend it to anyone. I wasted hours of my life for the achievements and now I hate myself for my worthless struggle.

23199599.review:
Yes, it's a casual game. Yes it's got microtransactions. 

Does this make it bad? No way!

I had actually never played a solitaire mahjong game before and for some reason decided to get this one. 

It's free, it's relaxing, which is exactly what I wanted. The tile matching puzzles are fairly easy but you can try to complete them in a short a time as possible if you want more of a challenge. I mainly just play a round or two before bed to chill out. Birdsong and brain massaging tile matching are a good thing.

Sure, the storyline is ultimately pointless imo, but hey, if you like that extra stuff good on you. 

I will point out that I'm writing this only because there was a message in game prompting me to. Honestly, that normally counts as a bad mark in my book, but I'll let it slide this time, because I am genuinely enjoying the game.

It's free, so give it a go. If it's not for you just move on to something else!

23141156.review:
A game where you have to wait for energy to use in order to play.
Completing a game of mahjong within a limited time you will be reward you with random items which are used to complete collections, unlock new areas and complete quests.
It’s highly repetitive and the stories are pointless (you really don’t need to read a single word in the game.)
The quests are the same things over and over, find certain items, play a certain area or interact with the creatures walking around the world map.

It’s copied and pasted from their game Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure.
No effort put into it, all images and 'story' are kept identical, they even included items for night mode which isn't available in Mahjong.
All they've done is replace the hidden object game with Mahjong instead.
You’re constantly shown "offers" of micro-transactions.

The only improvement is the Steam achievements are easier to get, instead of grinding to level 5 you get them at level 1.

Purely just a cash grab for anyone gullible enough to make the in-game purchases.
If you want free achievements then go for it, that's the only good thing I can say about this game if you like collecting them.

Interesting twist on Mahjong. 
Yeap, there's microtransactions if you feel like wasting money on mahjong. Don;t see why anyone would, other than to help the devs out.  You really don't need to pay to win this game. It's Mahjong. Relax.

Energy refill is slow, but not an issue for me. Lets me know when it's time to stop and go play something else or resume normal oofline life activities. Like having a life.

Relaxing game, storyline and quests make it interesting. The chest puzzles are a bit annoying, really slows the flow of the game. But an interesting idea, if not so well executed here. Free, always a plus. 

Okay, Free, Only reason I am playing it on Steam instead of playing any of the other gazillion free online mahjong games. Or even Mahjong Titans offline. 

6/10 for the game.
1/10 for the mini-games/puzzles.
10/10 for FREE

22779174.review:
Mahjongと書いてあるが、日本では上海と言う名前で知られるゲーム。
上海が出来るエリアが15個あり、エリア毎に10ステージ有り。
基本の内容はよくある上海であるが、制限時間付でその延長・ヒント機能・シャッフル機能はゲーム内アイテムを使用する形になっている。
またミニゲームがいくつもあり、宝箱を開くときにミニゲームが発生する。（中身は基本素材や使用アイテム等）
コレクション的な要素や、施設の作成、徘徊する敵を倒すといった要素（アイテムを使用するだけ）もあり、ただの上海だけでは無い内容となっている。
しかし、行動力制なので、それを回復するアイテムやエリアを攻略するのに必要なアイテム、コレクションアイテム等が課金要素として存在する。（ゲーム内でも手に入る）


ゲームの進行としてはクエストが随時発生するので、それをクリアする事で新たなクエストが発生し、序盤はエリアを開放するためのアイテムもクエストに沿えば手に入るようになっている。
ただ、クエストをクリアしないと次のクエストが出ないので、クリアしにくいからと残すと、敵の出現クエストが発生しなかったりするのは困るところ。
クエストに必要なアイテムは上海で手に入るものだと確定なのだが、それ以外の方法だと買う以外では確率となっており、そのせいで長い事嵌ったクエストがあったのは良くなかった。（買えないアイテムだった）
宝箱を手に入れると、ほぼ毎回2度開けるかどうか聞かれるのが地味にウザったく感じた。
施設作成でアイテムを時間で得られたりするのだが、出来上がったものを取得しないと次のカウントが始まらなかったり、上海プレイ中の時間は施設の時間が進まなかったりするのは少々残念だった。
また、Lvが上昇すると24時間限定のスペシャルオファーと言うのが出て来るのだが、内容は現金でゲーム内アイテム等を割引で買える、というものなので注意。



色々書いたが、上海としての出来は悪くないので、ちょっとした暇つぶしにはなる。
無料でプレイできるものとしては及第点だろう。

22694898.review:
[h1]One of those "quest" games with a lame story, that uses mahjong as its main game element.[/h1]
The premise is that you, an elf king of sorts, are stuck on an island and need to find a way to escape. There's not much of a story except you need to go find or gather items to help get yourself and your followers off this island. [i]Booooooring.[/i]

[h1]Not for those who want enjoy no-frills mahjong.[/h1]
This one contains loads of inane story dialogue, which is basically just you trying to transact with other creatures on the isle to get what you want. Though mahjong is the main game type here, there are other types of minigames as well, but I found them a tad lame, non-challenging, and just not fun in general. And the mahjong games are way too simple, and the interface too low-res to be appealing in any manner.

[h1]I guess the point is to make you spend money.[/h1]
I didn't feel bugged by having to make any in-game purchases (though obviously this was the intention) to advance in the game, but this was simply because the game couldn't hold my interest quite enough to reach this point. I did get the (very strong) impression that paying actual, real-life money, was a bit of a necessity though. (Which I wouldn't have minded had this game been more interesting.)

[h1]It's just way too blah.[/h1]
I dunno. If I wanted to play mahjong, I'd download a "serious", "actual" mahjong game, and not this thing. And if I wanted a story-rich, narrative-driven game, I'd choose an actual adventure game and not this. This is neither here nor there - it tries to be both, and fails miserably.

22433970.review:
I only reccomend this game, if you're not impatient on when you can play. (Also got motivated in rating this since I got something in return, but either way, I'd still reccomend this to any casual gamer). 

It's a standard mobile to pc game, except that there's no real neccessity to pay, as nothing is overly demanding in that get everything right (what I mean to say is that messing up doesn't mean you have to pay real money to try again). The leveling up is an interesting enough part in that it makes me feel like I'm making progress regardless of if I remain in he same region for quite a while. On top of that, there's an assortment of rewards which might make for a longer gaming session until you wait, but I digress.

This game is worth it if you simply have a few minutes to spare (5-10 minutes), which means you don't need to invest yourself for a long period of time. At least, I highly suggest that's how you play, unless you want to bitch about the energy system. 

Anyways, I don't know if this review will help, but long convoluted story short, it's an okay free to play casual game.

Rather enjoyable and addicting.  A nice break from all the FPS and multi person combat games. Your character is placed on a map of a wondrous land and you get quests to fulfil, each requires components that can only ba gained by solving mah jong puzzles. Only problem is that each puzzle depletes your energy stores, and you must get power ups in order to keep going. You start saying I will play only 15 minutes worth and then find three hours have passed.  The music is nice and relaxing too. A good way to unwind after a hard evening of killing whatever foes you have been fighting.


**** UPDATE*****

The geam is fixed so that even though it is "free to play" many of the puzzles become insoluble after a certain level, forcing you to pay to buy "gems" and/or "gold coins' in order to continue. Many items needed to access new location or complete quests just become unobtainable unelss you do this. Just a warning.

22344917.review:
Pros

- Quest system
- Many puzzles
- Level-up system
- Nice music


The game does look nice & I like the music though at times it can get distracting and not suit the puzzle genre, at certain points the music sounds like you are in a deadly battle instead of a puzzle game like this.

The levels are nice & it is nice to go back to try and get full-stars per level. You have a quest system which is nice and can get some to play more & I do like the art style. It has a lot of puzzle layouts to fit your needs & I do enjoy mahjong.

Weapons you find are used for quests or you can click on the roaming monsters and defeat them for items needed for quests. This is the only thing I can see you using your in-game gold on.


Cons

- Chest unlocks
- Energy counter
- Clearly should be a mobile game

You can get chests, however they need a puzzle to unlock which is not Mahjong but connect the colours-type puzzle. This is ok but they have a timer on them, meaning you will fail if you don't figure it out. Annoying for something you just did a puzzle for to even get & now need to solve another to unlock it. I guess be happy you don't need keys or CASH to unlock these chests.
Oh wait, you need energy to TRY and unlock them. Bogus seeing as it cost you energy to try and be lucky enough to find the chest & items inside you easily get off monsters or in the other levels anyway!

You have an energy counter which refills +1 every 3 minutes. You need at least 15/20 to play one puzzle & unless you have leveled up, you will only be playing 3-4 games for around 15 minutes & then waiting  2-3 hours just to play it again. With this system & the fact of course the items needed to refill your energy meter to play longer are indeed CASH. You do get gems however by leveling up as well as your energy is full again and you have more meaning you can play longer. So not all is lost.
The later levels are more expensive in enery terms to play and this is annoying when it is indeed easy to LOSE because the tiles purposely stack the same symbol on-top of each other.

-------------------------------------------------------

The energy system is annoying but the game is free after all. Play it in short bursts like a game like this should be played in so I don't mind it as much as others. I do say the energy system does fit in since yes, the developers of this game do deserve to get paid some way or another for this.

You can still play this for free and not spend a dim as long as you get used to playing 4 games or so every hour and then waiting.

22316613.review:
[h1]Маджонг с сюжетом[/h1]

[b]Я очень люблю маджонг. Начал играть в него еще тогда, когда он был бесплатным приложением для Windows. Другой вопрос в том, умею ли я его складывать. Но когда я увидел в стиме бесплатную Lost Lands: Mahjong – я ни секунды не сомневался в том, что я ее скачаю и опробую. [/b]

Отношение к бесплатным играм у меня всегда настороженное. Никогда не знаешь, чего ожидать от этого проекта. Кривой графики? Новаторских идей? Много доната? Чудной атмосферы? В бесплатных играх может быть все из вышеперечисленного, поэтому предсказать содержание той или иной игры очень трудно. Запуская данную игру я, скорее всего, ожидал от нее лютого доната даже для старта игры, но был приятно удивлен. 
Игра встречает нас красивым роликом, который рассказывает нам сюжет сего проекта. Да, это будет маджонг с сюжетной составляющей. Сейчас модным стало делать различные офисные игры с сюжетными вставками. Как по мне, так это очень хорошо, что разработчики приняли решение улучшить классическую игру сюжетной составляющей. Так вот, история повествует нам о королевстве славных эльфов, над которым нависло страшное зло. Эльфы были вынуждены покинуть родные земли и искать приюта в других местах. К несчастью, их корабли попали в штор и в живых осталось только несколько десятков ушастых созданий. Они то и сторожили саркофаг Древнего Эльфа, который, по приданиям, способен остановить надвигающееся зло. Именно этот Древний, который очнулся ото сна сразу же после катсцены, и будет нашим главным героем. Ну а дальше мы будем выполнять тонну заданий, в ходе которых будем играть в маджонг. Учитывая то, что сюжет развивается очень неспешно можно понять, что игра будет очень длинной. 
Стоит отметить очень приятный визуальное и музыкальное сопровождение. Картинка порадовала своей яркостью, насыщенностью и деталями еще на стадии вступительного ролика. А когда я увидел, как круто прорисованы локации, персонажи и карта – я просто растаял. Фигурки маджонга тоже хороши. На них новые, не привычные, рисунки. Хорошо, что разработчики решили не плагиатить это из других игр. Дополняет всю картину прекрасный звук. На заднем плане щебечут птички, текут ручьи, воет ветер… И поверх всего этого замечательный саундтрек. Отличная атмосфера создается. 
Донат… Наверное, каждый, кто читает этот обзор, ждал именно этого пункта. Конечно же, донат тут есть. Но донатить совершенно не обязательно. За донат покупаются ресурсы, которые можно выбить самостоятельно, подсказки, которые не очень нужны хорошим игрокам в маджонг и прочую лабуду, без которой можно спокойно играть. 

Ну а теперь немного о минусах игры. Первый из них – это модная вещь в современных мобильных и браузерных играх. Конечно же, речь пойдет об энергии, которая тратится во время игры. Каждый заход на уровень в этой игре стоит 10 энергии, которая восстанавливается достаточно долго. А если вам лень ждать и вы хотите приключений здесь и сейчас, то придется выкладывать реальные деньги. Но, снова таки, набравшись терпения и подождав этого можно избежать. Второй неприятный момент – это прохождение уровней на время. Лично я очень долго прохожу уровень в маджонг, так как не всегда замечаю парные фигурки. Здесь же вам дают 10 минут на то, чтобы сложить 72 пары фигурок. Я, конечно, сложил, но это чертовски трудно и довольно таки часто приходится тратить подсказки, которые потом можно будет купить лишь за реальные деньги. 

Но если вас не пугают вышеперечисленные минусы и вы любите маджонг, то можете смело скачивать данную бесплатную игру и вместе с Древним Эльфом спасать королевство от зла. 

[h1]Общая оценка: 7/10[/h1]

22295701.review:
Lost Lands: Mahjong ist an sich ein witziges Spiel das Mahjong mit einer Questreihe und Objective-Controll, so nenne ich es mal, versieht. Grafisch nett gemacht und übersichtlich. Steuerung und Questführung einfach. 

Ich würde das Spiel gerne loben, aber da ist diese eine Sache, die einfach ärgerlich ist und bleibt: der Energiebalken. Warum nervt es? Sobald man über die Anfangslevel hinaus ist kann man cirka 3-5 Games machen und muss dann mindestens eine Stunde warten, bis man eine weitere Runde (aber wirklich nur eine) spielen kann. Oder man bezahlt und zwar nicht gerade wenig (ich glaub Kristalle für ca. 3 Runden umgerechnet 2 Euro). Da zahle ich lieber einmalig 10 Euro und kann mich austoben wie ich will anstatt alle 30 Minuten für einen ganzen Tag im Spiel abgewürgt zu werden bzw. zu Mikrozahlungen genötigt zu werden. Eine andere Sache ist, dass die Mahjong-Level nur 2-3 Variationen pro Location anbieten, obwohl man gefühlt 100 mal an der selben Stelle Quests erfüllen muss. Mehr Variation wäre besser gewesen.

Schade, dass immer mehr Entwickler auf so eine Masche fahren (bsp. Daybreak ist da so ein ganz spezieller Fall, der durch solche Aktionen tolle Spiele regelrecht verhunzt).

Empfehlung? Von mir als Kettenzocker, der nicht jeden Tag fünf Mal anfangen und aufhören will ein Spiel zu spielen gibt es dazu ein nein. Lohnt sich eher für Personen, die auf einer mittellangen Bahnfahrt ein wenig zocken wollen oder auf den Bus warten. Also Gelegenheitszocker. Aber nicht die Sorte, die bei jeder Gelegenheit (a la Kettenraucher) zu dem Spiel greifen wollen.
