22212442.review:
Update on Expansion: There's really nothing new here, except for the Sacrificial Island, which now has (fucking hard) Mahjong levels. You play the son(!?) of the original charcter and are going over old territory. Most it involves going around resvisiting the old sites, collecting previous materials (unless you already happen to have them) and obtaing collections (often mutilple times). Often you'll have to obtain 8-15 of each item and 3 of the required collections, which takes up the time. So if you have a collection or material or weapons saved up from the first installment, you'll probably be using them up here. Not particularly satisfying because it's very repetitive and very little new. [spoiler]Collections: Elvin Ruler, Magic Potion, Amazing Nest, Spell Scrolls, Ledgendary Trophies, Deadman's Cave, Kitar's Belongings, Gambling, Magic Insects, Clan and Race Banners and Unusual Seeds do not need to be completed, although you'll probably find many of them have all the objects required.[/spoiler] I would not complete any unnecessary collections until needed because you'll likely have to collect them multiple times in subsequent expansions. And yes, another expansison is promised. 

Previous review: Recommended with some caveats. This is a Mahjong game within a time management/puzzle type game.  You play a round of Mahjong to obtain items, gold and power-ups. You use the items to combine and reach a goal, which gets you more gold and power-ups. Yes...it is also a game with micro-transactions where you can buy extras that you aren't able to get. If you're a piss-poor Mahjong player and/or want to play for hours at a time, then you'll probably have to spend money because you'll run out of energy. Normally, however, if you play about an hour or so and then return the next day, all your energy is restored and you can build up gold and gems to purchase incidentals without having to lay out actual hard cash. Also, every day there is a new bonus; it encourages to boot up the game on a daily basis. There are also puzzles to figure out to open chests where you can get more items. And leveling up gets you access to more places. 

I also like the natural sounds of birds, crickets, etc in the background along with light flute-like music. 

Personally, so far, I like it. It's different. And, hello, it's free. It's ridiculous to complain about the micro-transactions aspect when you're not having to pay for the game and purchases are not required unless you're impatient. If it gets to a point where it becomes too annoying, I'll just delete it. Mahjong games are common place. 

I give it a 4 out of 5.

Update: I have finished the game, although they've left it open for expansion. I hope they do add more levels. [spoiler]Several collections are not required: Elven Ruler, Magic Potion, Amazing Nest, Mechanical Inventions, Spell Scrolls, Legendary Torphies, Deadman's Cave, Katar's Belongings, Gambling, Magic Insects and Fairy Glade were all left undone.[/spoiler] So if you want, you can continue to solve chest puzzles, play the Mahjong levels, receive daily bonuses, etc. Note: I did not use any micro purchases to finish, although the completing the [spoiler]Black Magic[/spoiler] collection by obtaining the [spoiler]scythe[/spoiler] took a ridiculous number of "kills" to release it; that it seems like a bug.

If you love micro transactions, download this game. If you don't...then stay away. Even as a free game I rated it down due to the micro-transactions and energy system which really annoys me with these types of games. This game does have great parts but it is clearly following the mobile and facebook micro-transaction games that require you to wait time before you can do more levels or pay to get more energy or pay to buy items and unlocks. Now that isn't necessarily a bad thing if you are on a mobile platform or on facebook but I just feel that these sorts of games should be as far away from Steam as possible.

As a game, the graphics are great, the drawings and icons and world map and all the graphical elements are done really well, I do have to hand it to the devs who made this game for that. The storyline scenes at the start however are so low res you can see the pixels and how faded it looks due to the upscale of the video. Very poorly done.

There are some great puzzles in the game though especially when opening chests and having to connect the coloured dots. That is quite fun but time limited. I think overall it's a game that will appeal to those who are used to micro-transactions, and I'd enjoy this more if it didn't shove the desire to purchase at my face every two minutes. In addition, I cannot stand any game that has energy and stops you from playing and having to wait or pay for it to refill to continue. Games are meant to be played, not spent waiting until you can play it.

22160214.review:
Сразу факты.
Плюсы:
1. Красивая
2. 15 локаций с 10 раскладками в каждой
3. Играть довольно интересно
4. Есть подобие сюжета
Минусы:
1. Донать или гринди.
2. Локаций то 15 с 10 раскладками, НО раскладки не генерятся и фишки в них всегда лежат одинаково.
3. На открытие новых локаций нужны ресурсы (которые гриндятся или покупаются за реальные деньги)
4. Чтобы поиграть нужна энергия, +1 энергии генерится за 3,5 мин, первоначально на матч тратиться 20, потом 25, 30 и т.д.
Играть только если у вас МНОГО свободного времени и терпение буддиста или если не жалко денег.

P.S. Одно из заданий в игре написать тут отзыв

22123233.review:
[h1]Это первая игра в моей жизни, сама попросившая меня написать обзор!!! О_о[/h1]
Ну, что же, покорно исполняю её волю... xD

[b]Ничего плохого сказать о ней не могу![/b] и не потому, что она мягко намекнула на то, КАКУЮ оценку ей хочется получить (но мы догадываемся, конечно). Хоть и забавно бы было увидеть плачущую эльфийку, умоляющую игрока написать положительный обзор, потому что иначе весь её народ погибнет в огне...
Но это уж слишком дерзкий ход! :)

[h1]Что она из себя представляет?[/h1] Ну, у игры говорящее название...
Перед нами маджонг, а точнее — [b]пасьянс маджонг[/b], пррррошу не путать. 

Ну знаете, вам предлагается некая многослойная конструкция из фишек с рисунком, которую вам нужно разобрать посредством поиска пар с одинаковыми рисунками.
В процессе игры вы обратите внимание на то, что всё не настолько просто и что всё же нужно [b]думать[/b]: в силу особенности конструкции, костяшки размещены неровными слоями с пирамидальной формой (нет, структура может быть самой разной, но не плоской. Обычно). 
И почти все костяшки скрыты под верхними слоями, какие-то из них совсем не видно, а какие-то видны. И если хватать одинаковые костяшки без раздумий, можно оказаться в патовой ситуации. Так что нужно думать и следовать алгоритму, и... 
...[b]аррр... ну зачем я пытаюсь это объяснить, 
если можно сказать стандартное «Хотите узнать о маджонге — Google в помощь».. :( [/b]
Тем более, что многие уже знакомы с этой настольной игрой, даже если не помнят её названия! 

[h1]Ну а для пущего интереса в игру добавлены:[/h1]
[list]
  [*] сюжет, способный заинтересовать детей всех возрастов (и не только детей, благодаря красивой эльфийке, поминутно мелькающей перед глазами, презентуя очередной квест);
  [*] таймер, который заставит вас думать и действовать шустрее, иначе вы лишитесь вкусных плюшек(!), ведь ими награждают самых быстрых;
  [*] и конечно же [h1]ДОСТИЖЕ-Е-Е-Е-Е-ЕНИЯ,[/h1] которые ничего вам не дают, кроме сомнительного морального удовлетворения с возможностью покрасоваться всей иллюзорностью вашего величия перед друзьями. 
Только не обижайтесь... это просто самоирония.
[/list]

Игра не слишком требовательно относится к наличию у игрока [b]памяти[/b] и... не даст заскучать вашей [b]наблюдательности[/b], потому что они вам понадобятся. 
Игра достаточно интересная, кстати.
Здесь следовало бы уточнить: не конкретно эта игра.. а маджонг сам по себе. 
Но против [b]Lost Lands: Mahjong[/b] ничего против не имею, красиво нарисовано!
Тем более, что она, внимание, [b]бесплатная![/b]
[h1]Бесплатная!![/h1] 
[h1]БЕСПЛАТНАЯ!!![/h1]
[strike]Нет, меня бы удивило, будь она платной о_О[/strike] 
Шучу, меня уже ничто не удивит...(: 
Но донат поощряется, как всегда, так что все будут довольны ^-^

22114875.review:
[U]GAMEPLAY[/U]
City builder:
Re-build a city and gain access to new locations.
Collect items to do that and fulfill quests, or purchase them.

Mahjongg solitaire matches to obtain the items. 10 different boards per location unlocked, you can repeat the ones you rather (more easy ones, more difficult, or just the cooler one for you). The reward will be the same.The selected one auto jumps in order to not repeat them if you keep playing on the same location to obtain some items.

7 Mini games (on chests) some easier, some harder (with a random level of difficulty from playing blid to get mad). 

Energy bar to make you stop playing to wait to refill (or use items) or purchase those items. Still how much time you can play this game without pause? Perhaps more or less than the energy you have + level up refill.

______________

Nice art, nice story (few background/lore) keep playing mahjongg solitaire.
RECOMENDED FOR CASUAL PLAYING a bit every day. It may take a lot of time to get all the achievements or end the story. But all in all is pleasent.

Can be played without spending money, purchases with wallet are extremelly well integrated. Still the game don't annoys or rushes you with them.
______________

It's the same game as the Hidden Object Version, but I rather this one than the super time-limited HOG more when it's not on my language, hate HOGs in English. So for me there's no problem at all in having it in two versions.

22091530.review:
I really like to play Mahjong, and all things fancy aside, LL:M gets the core right. That's good. That's ... essential, even.

It comes with a little lore of its own which contains elves, temples, cave cobolds, golems and the like, all trapped on the same island. Nothing impressive, of course. But it totally delivers if you like fantasy.

The NPC artwork is GORGEOUS (*_* )   I know it's a simple trick to let minor parts of an image sway back and forth to make i.e. hair look like it floats in the wind, but it looks beautiful nevertheless.

Gameplaywise, there's a hub filled with quests which ultimately lead players to the precious *actual* game: several sessions of Mahjong. You start with little and gradually gain access to further assets on the island. Totally with an XP leveling system and everything. I don't like how it *costs* health points to play Mahjong, given that that's the actual game players are gonna want to play.

The tutorials, though, are SUPER-bad. They literally stop the entire gameplay functionality and force you to click on button X or icon Y. That's not how you teach someone anything, that's how you indoctrinate ..... but whatever.

22027343.review:
Decent version of solitaire mahjong. The field layouts are various, but each field seems to have a static layout. That is to say if the field looks like a house, all the tiles will not be random but seem to be placed in the same spot (though the tile marking gets switched if you repeat play) This is probably done to keep all fields 'solvable' but it takes a bit out of the fun.

There's plenty to do with lots of quests and lots of various bonus puzzles in chests. Sadly there's a major drawback with only a limited supply of "energy" which is needed to do stuff (read your playing currency) and as you progress more energy is needed per map/field in order to progress further. Luckily you can expand your very limited energy level by getting xp or completing certain buildings, it's not an ideal situation. 

I could only play for about 30 minutes per session before running out of energy, a lot less time if I simply spend my energy on opening chests. Then a long wait is needed to get new energy or you have to spend crystals or items you farmed/bought in order to continue.

It's pretty addicitive if you like to complete stuff (achievement hunter) like I do, but there's still a few errors in this game, a very very low droprate of a certain key items somewhere mid-game that can take eons to get and some other minor issues like the reshuffle tiles item not really helping at all.

21997977.review:
I wanted to write the review yesterday but my mind was elsewhere. Anyway, I've played a little more the game. So what's with this free-to-play game?

Lost Lands: Mahjong is based on the universe of Lost Lands, a hidden object adventure series set in another dimension or I suppose so because the games are done by the same people, with the same title. However, here, you take in your hands the destiny of the Elven Nation, crashed on a lost island, rebuilding their civilization and ready to set sail elsewhere if only a magical storm wasn't preventing them to do so.

This is the second free-to-play released by Five-BN. The first one, Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure, shares the same story, the same quests and the same mechanics. It means that apart the core gameplay (hidden objects - mahjong), nothing changed when the second was released. I've played Mahjong first because I love the solitaire version of this game and A Hidden Object Adventure came after. It also means that some passages have been copy/pasted to my review of the first game and that others have been rewritten.

Anyway, I love Mahjong, especially the version here, the solitaire gameplay where you have to remove all tiles by finding pairs of them. There is nothing wrong here, I'm enjoying this.

Quests, while needing explorations for anything (weapons, tools, ressources, etc..), can also involve "fights" with enemies, repairing buildings or using tools. Also, the more you're earning experience, the more you're leveling up and the more you're unlocking. There are also chests you can open, with various minigames (and not always easy). Everything is timed and the explorations, as the chests, cost energy.

And that's bothering me, the energy regenerating slowly unless you buy some potions with the crystals you're earning. Crystals are pretty rare but there is the easy way: spent real money to acquire them (or to acquire more golds). Gold is mainly used for weapons for example. Here's an idea for the cost: 10 crystals = 0.88 euros - I've checked the next price and it's already nearing 10 euros). 

I don't mind having quests to do and I don't mind the level up system to access new locations. Even the shop isn't really bothering, as far as you can use the gold you're earning. However, preventing me to play a game because of a decreased energy on Steam, that's something I can't imagine. For me, that kind of gameplay is reminding me of my Facebook games time. Weirdly enough, it would have been on Facebook, I would have find it normal. Here, on Steam, I'm not at ease with the concept. Ubisoft released games about CSI and Assassin's Creed on Facebook, yet, the main series were totally different.

You'll probably find it weird that I'm bothered by the Facebook-like when the game is a free-to-play and that the concept of the energy is also there to push you to buy some (the game is also released on Android and iOS devices). But that's my feeling. Many people will feel that they're trapped and will want to advance. However, I tend to use a simple thought to avoid spending money: there is no rush. You're there for fun (I'm not reading the story though).

As for the rest, the graphics are acceptable and pleasant, the soundtrack being the same. If you played any other Lost Lands, you'll be in an familiar setting.

It's still mahjong, so I can overcome easily the energy bar, the game is still enjoyable. It's free basically, so try it but DON'T FALL INTO THE "NEED ENERGY" TRAP. If there are indeed micro-transactions, don't fall in that pit of addiction. You don't need to go forward immediately. Just quit the game and come back later. It's the best way to play these kind of games, because after all, you're not going to be attacked by another player, your quests aren't timed and besides, why would you rush?

Last for all, why did I thumb up both games when only the gameplay changed? I'm enjoying them, they're free and besides, it's not like I'm wasting my money here...

Not a bad little game.  I'm enjoying the story, even if it is a touch confusing.  And I don't mind sitting through that it opens on an ad page being it is free to play.

Haven't had any microtransactions shoved hard at me.  Yes, there are deals and I've been made aware but nothing feels pushy which I appreciate.

I am glad the game shows what tiles are clickable all the time since for some reason I have a super hard time getting ym eyes to stay focused when looking at the board.  I'm sure some of it is my own poor eyes but some of it is how the tiles look, not sure wha'ts up with that.

Turned the music off pretty quickly, got a bit too distracting for longer plays.

Do wish a few more things were explained a little better when you first start.  Like the collections and exactly how to play the unlock puzzle with the colored dots.  I had no idea that the one funny looking tile meant I could put one under and one over for that spot.

Though I do like that failing to unlock a chest doesn't re-set the board when you try again.

Overall, not a bad game.  Very much a game don't think I'd have looked into if it wasn't free to play though.

21983321.review:
This game has a storyline that plays in the Elven world. You have to rebuild certain areas. You get quests that you'll have to complete, and completing them gives... more quests.

A big part of this game consists of playing Mahjongg boards. There is a time limit, and you can use a few power-ups to help you out a little (like 'shuffle' to shuffle all the tiles when you have no more moves).
Also, there are several minigames that you'll have to play once in a while.

I like the mixture of the games (the addition of minigames to the Mahjongg game), and I like that you'll actually have to follow quests in order to 'progress' the story. I also like the price of this game - it is free to play.

What I do not like that much is that you cannot rush the game (well, at least not for free). You start with energy units, and they replenish over time. Each board that you play will cost some energy. So when you've played a few boards, you've run out of energy. At that time you can either wait (quit the game and come back later), you can 'purchase' energy items in the Elven Store (with in-game currency), and use those items to refill (part of) your energy, or you can purchase 'in-game currency' by paying with real-life money (or at least I think it works that way - I have not been able to test it out yet).

This game is meant to be played daily, casually (as far as I can tell). You even get better bonus items if you start the game (at least) once a day.
If you enjoy playing a Mahjongg board once in a while, while following quests, then you should give this game a try. But if you want to play dozens of boards in a multi-hour gaming session, then there might be better Mahjongg board games out there.

I am writing this review because the game asked me to write one, and I am not that far in the game yet (I have played around 3 hours now, on several days combined). If I discover more things later in the game/storyline, then I might add them to this review later.

21978440.review:
Ein weiteres Spiel aus der "Lost Lands"-Reihe, hier: Mahjong.


Pros:
+ Kostenlos
+ Umfangreich
+ Enthält sehr leichte Steam-Errungenschaften
+ Versch. Schwierigkeitsgrade
+ Story vorhanden, aber Nebensache
+ Levelbasierte Freischaltung neuer Locations
+ Ansehbare Grafik, Hintergrundbilder usw.
+ Schwierigkeit einzelner Locations steigt mit wiederholter Erforschung
+ Spielrunden laufen auf Zeit (Geschmackssache)
+ Man kann täglich ein paar Runden spielen, über langen Zeitraum

No´s:
- Errungenschaften sind sehr zeitaufwendig (bis zu 50 Std. und mehr)
- Energiebasiert, ist sie leer heißt es warten oder zahlen
- Absolut gleiche Aufmache und nahezu komplett gleiche Videos wie in anderem Lost-Land-Titel
- Man kann aufgrund der Energie nur ein paar Runden täglich spielen
- Leider ist es eine Art "Pay2play"
- Zunächst spielt man wenige Locations immer wieder
- Neue Locations freizuschalten ist müselig und zeitaufwendig oder kostet Bargeld (über Umwege)
- Spielrunden laufen auf Zeit (Geschmackssache)
- Es gibt keine Anpassung der Spielsteine, Hintergrundbilder oder dergleichen
- Die Kaufaufforderung hilfreicher Gegenstände, Münzen oder Diamanten mag aufdringlich erscheinen

Hier findet Ihr detaillierte Infos zum Spiel und zu den Errungenschaften:
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/LFA-JISE/discussions/18/364039531226997835/

Fazit: 
Ich besitze mehrere Spiele der "Lost-Land"-Reihe, darunter ein fast identisches HiddenObject-Spiel, und bin ein wenig enttäuscht darüber, dass man gerade bei Gelegenheitsspielen, Minispielen - oder wie auch immer Ihr sie nennen möchtet - daran gehindert wird sie etwas ausgiebiger zu spielen. Gerade wenn ich nebenbei andere Dinnge zu tun habe, würden solche Spiele gut passen. Aber den halben Tag zu warten, damit man dann mal spielen kann ist nicht ganz mein Geschmack. Möchte man unbedingt ein solches Spiel haben, immerhin ist es kostenlos ;) , so kann man sich das ruhig antun. Aber generell gibt es zahllose ähnliche Spiele, die kostenlos sind und Euch dann spielen lassen, wann Ihr es möchtet.

PPS: Zwar ein völlig anderes Spiel, aber da kann man sich lieber "This war of Mine" kaufen und dann einen DLC kaufen für 99 Cent, diese werden wirklich EINEM GUTEN ZWECK GESPENDET!!!

So keep coll and PlayReal!

21964468.review:
[h1]Что сказать-то?[/h1]

Скажу, как есть.

Я немного в растерянности от того, что испытывать к данному творению. Меня, существо по сути своей нерасторопное, напрягает тот момент регламентированности времени сбора расклада. С одной стороны, приятно-таки почувствовать тонус, с другой - затруднительным представляется релакс. Против тебя подгоняющее время, невозможность возврата назад, замыленные глаза. В случае трудностей игра стимулируют прожать расходуемые подсказки. Расклады часто заходят в тупик - использование перемешивания не всегда помогает. Часто приходится начинать ту же игру снова и искать подход разбора. А еще важна энергия! Нет, не твоя. Энергия персонажа. Нет энергии? Потрать внутреигровых ресов. Нет? Вкинь денег, глупый. Ну, или жди завтра. Увеличение объема энергии или скорость восстановления нужные штуки - это станет возможным при улучшении строений на карте. Для того нужны материалы для строительства, выбивающиеся непосредственно игрой в маджонг. Или падающих из сундуков. Очень много путей сводятся к вкидыванию денег и полунавязчивая реклама часто выползает помозолить глаза своей стилизацией "дорого-богато". Глупо и почти наивно думать, что эти уловки будет отсутствовать в бесплатной игре. А с другой стороны, невозможность погрузиться на дольше в процесс игры, переутомления не вызовет, но, вероятно, она вам быстро наскучит.

Что касается сюжета, то тут разрабы, конечно, пытались разнообразить процесс игры его добавлением. Но мне, привыкшей к виндовозовскому творению, кажется, не доставила история местного героя, что почти ничем не отличающаяся от того же добродушного довакина Скайрима, собирающего по всему королевству цветную капусту, унижаемого всяческими препятствиями и пытающегося верить, что он достоин большего. Тут так же, но с анимированными эльфами, скудным текстом и глупо-очевидным и маджонгом имитирующем путешествия, помощи, битвы. Нужна ли эта имитация? Но зато с возможностью карьерного роста, увлечением коллекционированием и достижениями. Помимо раскладов присутствуют неплохие головоломки, запрятанные по сундукам, что напомнят вам LYNE, игру "Мышеловка", прочие паутинки и самобытные пазлы.

[i]Как вывод: вполне годный таймкиллер на несколько дней, а может и месяцы, для нетребовательных ПК и непридирчивых к вышеописанному геймеров. Меж тем, судя по медленному развитию сюжета, предполагется дооооолгое погружение. Хотя, боюсь, что анальные пытки донатом и ограничения в процессе игры быстро сведут весь интерес на нет.[/i]

My advice: Stay away from it (Until they change the energy mechanics and actually let you PLAY the game).

Ну чтож.. вот я и дожил до дней, когда в стиме начали появляться игрушки из социальных сетей вроде вконтактика и одноклассничков.. и не сказать, что я этому так уж сильно рад, но ктож меня спрашивать-то будет, верно?
 Соглашусь с теми, кому не понравилось превращение спокойной залипаловки, которой маджонг и является по своей сути, в гонку за секундомером. Но как же иначе можно мотивировать игроков покупать что-либо за реал в бесплатной игрушке, если не создавать для того "благоприятной атмосферы"? Скины и шапки тут не прокатят, это вам не КС и ТФ2.. значит добавим энергию (пожалуй саааамый распространённый регулятор игрового времени), чтобы этим халявщикам (т.е. нам) было особо не разыграться.. Повесим замки на каждый кусочек контекта и сделаем многоступенчатую систему разблокировки, которую проще пройти "за реал" (т.к. энергии не сильно-то и много, зато тратится влёт), чем [strike] задрачивать [/strike] проходить по-человечески.. А чтобы уж совсем народ не расслаблялся - сделаем прохождение уровней на время! ДокторЗлоМизинчик.гиф
 Резюмируя всё вышесказанное: бесплатная? это хорошо, конечно.. но пусть уж такие игры остаются на фейсбуках и вконтакте.. Стим уже и так переполнен [strike] говном 	[/strike] всевозможными приложениями низкого и сомнительного качества, не стОит эту кучу увеличивать..

I do not hate micro-transactions because when used sparingly they can be quite good for everybody, frugal players and spenders alike.  But the way they are implemented here is totally overbearing.

I don't recommend this - not a chance.

"Ein Mahjongg-Spiel  mit Story? Was soll das?" war zumindest mein erster Gedanke. Aber auch wenn die Story nur aufgesetzt ist, und mit dem Freiräumen der Mahjongg-Boards wenig zu tun hat, so ist es doch ein schön gezeichnetes Drumherum.
Man schlüpft in die Rolle des letzten der ersten Elfen, der nun sein Volk, das vor dem Bösen geflohen ist, wieder aufbauen muss, hierfür muss man einige Mahjongg-Boards spielen, und wird mit Gegenständen belohnt, die einem helfen, in der Geschichte weiterzukommen, oder aber andere Nebenmissionen zu erfüllen, für die man wieder neue Gegenstände bekommt. Es ist kein Spiel, an dem man stundenlang sitzenbleiben kann oder will, aber für zwischendurch ist es ganz nett.

21915806.review: Да, это старый маджонг. Главная цель не очки, а то, что можно найти при решении данной головомки. Найденные предметы помогут в решении квестов и в строительстве. Да, именно так.На острове много разрушенных построек, и при их востановлении возможно будет добывать определенные предметы, которые в свою очередь понадобятся для следующего восстановления здания. Так же есть знакомые с андройда головоломочки. Для меня это хороший тайм-киллер, при этом есть какая-то цель и возможность что-то улучшить. Тем более маджонг развивает внимательность и логику(да снимать все подряд одинаковые фишки не всегда получается, поэтому приходится думать, какую пару убрать сейчас, а какую можно попозже). А также  доволно хороший сюжет. Советую.

21895165.review:
It is a typical Facebook like game that gives you about 30 mins to an hour of playing time and then you have to wait for your energy to refill slowly over a few hours.  Otherwise you have to buy energy or items for a buck or two.

It's a fun tile matching game that encourages the player progress with various quests to find different items.  It looks very nice and has a nice soundtrack.  I was actually looking for a real Mahjong game, but the mindless tile matching sucks you in.

It does get annoying when you just randomly get a board that has no way to complete it and you have to start over.  There are many different tile setups and you are timed with better awards if you do it fast enough.

It is free so what is there to lose but your life?

游戏内容不错，比Windows Store内的Microsoft Mahjong更具有挑战性（包括收集材料制作东西的成分在里面），[b]***但是但是但是***[/b]个人对体力系统非常讨厌[spoiler]大约开发者脑袋被门夹了[/spoiler]。不过作为一个免费的游戏（抛开体力系统）来说，还是一个不错的消磨时光的游戏。

[b]绕开体力系统[/b]
把你的电脑的时间和日期设置打开放在边上，体力没了就把日期往后改一天，保存设置，切回游戏，体力回满，然后再把日期改回去，保存设置，切回游戏继续玩。
***建议开窗口模式游玩，省得切换时老是闪来闪去怪难受的***

21867923.review:
Mit Mahjong verbinde ich fernöstlichen Zeitvertreib, denke da an Go und Go Beng. Langsam und bedächtig, ja fast meditativ soll man die Unruhe des Tages bei einem kleinen Spiel abschütteln. So wählen fast alle anderen Mahjong-Games logischerweise ein chinesisches Setting, mit mehreren Spielmodi, wobei eines immer "klassisch" heißt und auf eine Erzählung verzichtet.

Hier bei Lost Lands hat man sich für eine Story-Line entschieden, die sehr aufgesetzt und überbordend wirkt. Zumal diese Fantasy Hintergrundgeschichte eher stört als dass sie den Mahjongteil trägt. Jedes Wesen, das hier erscheint verteilt zufällige Aufgaben, die wiederum mit Mahjong absolut nichts zu tun haben. Danach klickt man sich durch ein halbes Dutzend Fenster nur um festzustellen, dass man  dort, wo man landet zur Zeit nichts machen darf aber in 20 Leveln mal wieder gerne reinschauen soll. So dauert es eine gefühlte Ewigkeit bis man Mahjong spielen darf. 
Wenn man denn genug Energie hat!

Es läuft hier alles auf Energie hinaus. Weniger transzendal erleuchtete Menschen wie ich sagen umgangssprachlich auch "Geld" dazu. Es ist ein PtW Game, ohne Energie muss man halt nach ein paar Spielen pausieren bis sie sich wieder regeneriert hat. Da ist es halt einfacher, man holt sich ein reines Mahjong-Spiel ohne Klimbim und spielt, wenn man Lust hat. Es gibt davon eine Menge, die absolut kostenlos spielbar sind und eine sehr gute Qualität bieten. Ohne Energieschwund in der Geldbörse.

Fazit: Für ein PtW wird hier zu wenig geboten. Es gibt zu wenig Anreiz weiter zu spielen, es sei denn es reicht dem Spieler, wenn der nächstbeste Troll ihm aufträgt seine Brücke zu reparieren. Weitere Schwächen: Es gibt nur ein Spielmodus, die Uhr lässt sich nicht abstellen. Das Schlimmste ist aber, dass sich die Sets nach ein paar Anfangsleveln wiederholen. Nach zwei weiteren Leveln kennt auch der Gedächtnisschwächste die Lage der Steine. Malefiz lässt grüßen.

21861865.review:
A superb Mahjong game that is both challenging and fun, with 10 different Mahjong boards per location, and it even comes with achievements.    

First, let us start with the usual and biggest Steam community complaint: micro-transactions.  Though this game has micro-transactions the player NEVER, EVER has to buy anything so this IS NOT a pay to win game.  The player can, of course, spend money for crystals and coins if they chose.  Remember this is a coffee break or lunch break game, meant to be played in 15-20 minute increments over days, weeks, possibly months depending on one's dedication or committment to the game.  This game can not be played to conclusion in one sitting.

This particular game Lost Lands: Mahjong (LL: M)  has the exact same storyline and pretty much the same achievements as Lost Lands: A Hidden Object Adventure (LL: HO).  However, the developers have taken to heart all the comments, compliants and suggestions offered about Lost Lands: HO and improved the overall gameplay of Lost Lands: Mahjong immensely.  

First of all, steam achievements are earned at the first in-game achievement level up instead of the last as in LL: HO so LL: M is not the grind LL: HO is.  Secondly, the amount needed to level up has been adjusted to fit the achievement such as needing an immense amount of coins to earn that achievement versus earning a location and critter achievement which only requires a very small amount play or items.  10 stars per location and 10 weapons per critter to be exact.  (Just a note:  The coin achievement is very high, and seemingly impossible, however remember there are 15 locations and a player needs a rank of 21 to open the final locations.  Trust me the coins needed to level up that achievement will eventually come just through game play, just as night mode and silhouette mode achievements will come through play.)  Third, the utterly useless achievement UNLUCKY found in LL: HO (not being able complete the scene within the time limit) will probably be one of the first achievements anyone earns in LL: M considering the challenge some Mahjong boards present.  (Any board that runs out of moves is considered eligible for the count on the UNLUCKY achievement.)  

I definitely recommend this Mahjong game for just the amount of Mahjong boards that eventually can be played (10 per location x 15 locations = 150 Mahjong boards total.)  As far as achievements go (for those that care) I will probably have all these achievements before LL: HO (lololol)

21832567.review:
If you love micro transactions, download this game. If you don't...then stay away. Even as a free game I rated it down due to the micro-transactions and energy system which really annoys me with these types of games. This game does have great parts but it is clearly following the mobile and facebook micro-transaction games that require you to wait time before you can do more levels or pay to get more energy or pay to buy items and unlocks. Now that isn't necessarily a bad thing if you are on a mobile platform or on facebook but I just feel that these sorts of games should be as far away from Steam as possible.

As a game, the graphics are great, the drawings and icons and world map and all the graphical elements are done really well, I do have to hand it to the devs who made this game for that. The storyline scenes at the start however are so low res you can see the pixels and how faded it looks due to the upscale of the video. Very poorly done.

There are some great puzzles in the game though especially when opening chests and having to connect the coloured dots. That is quite fun but time limited. I think overall it's a game that will appeal to those who are used to micro-transactions, and I'd enjoy this more if it didn't shove the desire to purchase at my face every two minutes. In addition, I cannot stand any game that has energy and stops you from playing and having to wait or pay for it to refill to continue. Games are meant to be played, not spent waiting until you can play it.

40811924.review:
Really relaxing game lots of fun
HOWEVER there are some pros and cons
Pros:
Easy to learn 
fun story so far
Great creative usage of gameplay
Plus there are mini games and puzzles and other game play mechanics not just mahjong

Cons:
Since this is Free To Play I can't blame them for doing this but there are in game purchases and sometimes with chests or deals the game can be a little pushy
Your energy can go really fast and having to pay for energy stinks but it's not too hard to get more energy with in game items you can get from enemy drops ect.
When you retry a level it will sometimes shuffle tiles but sometimes it won't which I think is odd as I believe should each time.

In the middle not pro or con
Also writing a review becomes a quest later on (doing that now) so I think it's a great way to write a review for the game and more people will likely do it because there is a reward but at the same time it does give off a mobile game begging for reviews and 5 stars when it doesn't deserve it.
I think weapon drops should be more common as I normally pay gold for weapons.

Some tips save your gold unless you really need it don't waste it.
Don't waste all your items either some items can only be bought with diamonds an in game purchasable item.

Conclusion I believe the game is a fun and relaxing game that offers new puzzles and challenges while also keep you on your feet as you are time with each puzzle. More time is added with each level so time so far has not been an issue. The core gameplay is great and offers a challenge.

If I gave this a rating on a 5 point scale I would say 3.5 as it does have a "mobile game feel" to it and the whole limit to the energy. 1 quest could wipe out more than half of your energy which is a little annoying. Incase anyone is wondering I am lvl 5. The final issue that keeps me from rating this a 4/5 is the constant hey check out our new game or hey new price drops or constant advertisement of the devs games. Not saying it's a bad thing but there are subtle ways of advertising take TF2 for example the awpers hand was an in-game item that was a reference to the awp in csgo. I used valve as an example but video game developers, companies, and studios have been doing this for years.

39957005.review:
Фірма Five-BN, мабуть, робила браузерні ігри, але зараз випускає їх у Steam. Отже, зустрічайте чергову гру про Загублені землі [b]Lost Lands: Mahjong[/b].
Є у нас карта, на карті локації. Коли заходимо в локацію, то граємо у маджонг. Можемо побачити як традиційні популярні фігури, так і нові, є навіть український тризуб. На вирішення головоломки дається 10 хвилин, я знімала всі кості за півтори-три хвилини. Існує можливість перемішати все, якщо зайшли у глухий кут; це не безкоштовно, звісно. Дуже дивно, що взагалі немає функції скасувати один останній хід, у маджонгу це важливо.
Крім власне китайської гри, наявні також монстри, які вештаються стежками, та скрині, які відкриваються за енергію. Так, тут є енергія, яку ми витрачаємо на виконання дій. І щоденні бонуси. І покупка всілякого непотребу, без якого можна обійтись. Пригадуєте, що я казала про браузерні ігри? Скрині відкриваються також після розгадування головоломок, але цього разу не маджонгу. Якщо відкрити скриню швидко, то зекономлену енергію не повернуть, що, як на мене, вельми журно. А ще після певного етапу настає епоха восьмигодинних квестів. Причому вони можуть бути такі: спочатку ми збираємо 10 мечів, якими проганяють кобольдів, і їх у нас забирають, а наступний квест буде "прогнати 7 печерних кобольдів". Та як його виконати, трясця, якщо я вже десяток мечів викинула в трубу? Насправді кожне 8-годинне завдання містить три малі задачі, і не завжди вистачає часу та енергії на виконання їх усіх. Що роблять "сонячні кристали", які видаються як винагорода за ці завдання, я так і не дізналась.
І, так як у цій грі є подоба сюжету ("сюжетні" завдання створені за класичним шаблоном РПГ [i]"піди туди, бо я сам не можу"[/i]), і тексту багато, то сильно впадає у вічі, що українська локалізація тут, гм... непрофесійна. А ще я відмовилась від завантаження збережень у "хмаринку", і, не знаю, чи з моєї вини, чи ні, вони злетіли, і все, кінець. Заново почати не можу, бо навчання зіштовхнулось із повислим восьмигодинним квестом. Ну, хоча б досягнень отримала.

[u]Підсумок: солідні ґеймери у таке не грають.[/u]

39899052.review:
It's a good enough game as in it is exactly what you think it is and functions well enough, but i wouldn't recommend it.  instead of easing you into the more challenging puzzles to get you used to it, it just starts off on hard mode to entice you into spending money on it.  you can only attempt a certain number of times before it drains your "stamina" and you either have to wait an absurd amount of time or spend your premium currency to buy more.  

if you just want to play a puzzle game, i suggest you look for one that isn't designed to bilk every last cent out of you.  this is just a cash grab with a pretty skin over it.
